review.itemreviewed: Sigma Wire D Twin Gate Carabiner
review.reviewBody: A perfect choice for winter climbing. I dont know how many times I have rappelled without locking my carabiner because it is froze. these take some getting used to especially with big gloves. Once you get the hang of it its a dream. No more breathing on your carabiners trying to get them to unlock. These are the only lockers on the market that do not freeze a huge advancement in the safety of winter climbing.
review.name: Does not freeze

description: Buy the Camp Chef Professional 14 1 Burner Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Professional 14 1 Burner Griddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Professional 14 1 Burner Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great griddle, better than I expected. I would recommend.
review.name: Great griddle

review.reviewBody: Great quality, quite heavy, perfect fit. Checkout process was easy. Shipping was affordable and quick.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody:
There's not much to say about the griddle, in the end it's a piece of metal that does what it's supposed to do. 
It's easy to clean and maintain, the bacon and other food you cook come out very nicely cooked.
The only reason why it gets 4 stars it's mainly due to the fact that there are parts where it's hotter than others and it might cook things unevenly if you don't know where these are.
Overall, a good purchase that will last for years.
review.name: Great addition to the sidekick

review.reviewBody: This griddle cracked down the middle first time warming up to season on medium heat.
review.name: Piece of crap!!!
comment:
Hi Unhappy Customer,

We are very sorry for your inconvenience. Please contact support@campchef.com and we would love to make things right.

review.reviewBody: Bought the new style sidekick and really do not like it at all burnt everything cannot control temp so got griddle to use on sidekick and it is a little better able to control heat but not near as good as old sidekick.
review.name: Griddle

review.reviewBody: Used the griddle for the first time this weekend.  Very happy once I figured out the heat distribution from the 2 burner Camp Chef.  Paid attention to seasoning it before use and it paid off as it cleaned up good!
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: Used on dozens of camping trips over 7+ years and honestly, I could easily feed 6-8 people with this thing. As a person who loves to camp and cook, my flat top griddle paired with a wok is all I need to cook just about everything. Heavy duty, easy to clean, even heat, and 10/10. Wish I had one in my kitchen!
review.name: Excellent piece of iron!

review.reviewBody: This is an indispensable tool for cooking for many. I used this to cook gyros for 200 folks with great success.  Heat dispersed well, and it stays hot for radiant heat and continuity. It gets hot so plan to sweat! If you cooking. A grease trap is offered as an accessory but should be standard. Grease will flow out and all over the leg of the stove/floor. Placed a cup in the provided hanging holder but the cup melted quickly. Also, a carrying bag should be standard.
review.name: Don’t hesitate to add this to your Kit.

review.reviewBody: Works great, easy to use and clean up fairly easy.
review.name: Love the griddle

review.reviewBody: This griddle is the perfect size for my camper. Love it
review.name: Great product

name: Professional 14 1 Burner Griddle

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, I had to return these. They were really cute… AND very tight across the top of the foot without much room for adjustment. They do not have the same give as other Chaco styles - I wouldn’t consider them adjustable any more than a pair of heals with a typical buckle strap. Even on the last hole on the buckle strap, they cut into the top of my foot. I wear an 8 in Chacos and usually a 9 in their boots. Very sad to have had to send the 8.5 I ordered back!!
review.name: Sad to say….
comment: We're bummed to hear these didn't work out for you and appreciate your feedback.

review.reviewBody: They run lathe so go down a size.  Super comfortable and cute!
review.name: Comfy and cute
comment: Cute and comfy! How could you go wrong!

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe over a year ago, or so.  Finally put them on this summer and now they are my go to.  They are super comfy and go with everything!  Also, I get tons of complements on them.  I plan to get them in black, as well.
review.name: Awesome shoe

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! They have a cushioned bottom and the straps are a soft leather feel. Comfortable for hours. They are my go-to shoes!
review.name: Love them!
comment: Excellent! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: these look nice and are comfortable, but a little heavy
review.name: look very nice, many compliments, a little heavy
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback!

review.reviewBody: I bought these sandals over the summer and am so happy with my purchase! I struggle with plantar fasciitis so my podiatrist recommended the Chaco brand for a supportive shoe and I was so happy to find these because they’re also very cute! They are my go-to summer sandal. Couldn’t recommend enough!
review.name: Cute and comfortable!
comment: Thanks for sharing your experience and recommendation Jess!

review.reviewBody: I LIVE in my Chacos and I love the look of these shoes but they’re very uncomfortable!
review.name: Tight on the top of the foot

review.reviewBody: Very stylish overall, but the backstrap is not very supportive and I find that it slides down very often.  Also at least in my shoe pair the quality of the leather is not that great on my third I noticed that the leather is already coming apart.
review.name: Cute but not functional

review.reviewBody: Size down. I usually 7.5 and wear 8 but needed to size down to 7. Very comfortable and soft but a little heavy.
review.name: Very comfortable
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Annabelle!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are NOT it. The straps broke after less than an hour of wear. After a few hours of sucking it up they became completely unwearable. Left work in borrowed socks - not my proudest moment. If you’re looking for great sandal, I’d recommend nearly any other shoes on this website. But the fake leather is NOT the move. Buyer beware!
review.name: As a long-time Chaco lover…
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

name: Townes Midform Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very nice boots for your lovely lady. Just make sure that if her foot is in need of a C-wide boot, these do not come in them, but there are others styles that do. This style is awesome and really cool for slip on and off with ease. Only if her feet aren't a "wide", lol. I do recommend this boot for sure.
review.name: Great style and design.

review.reviewBody: sizing...go down half size...comfortable, warm, waterproof....and they look great!
review.name: great boot!

review.reviewBody: Love this boot and it is very well made. The color is almost true to color. I’d say slightly more green than what i was thinking but still cute. Very comfortable
review.name: Excellent boot

review.reviewBody: These boots are super comfortable! Love the color!
review.name: Great purchase
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this boot.  We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.  Please contact info@ariat.com or give us a call at 1-877-702-7428  if you need further assistance in this matter.

review.reviewBody: Runs small and narrow. I am usually  a 10 medium. I could hardly get my foot in there without a sock. There were rough stitching that hurt. Really cute. Look really durable . Loved the color. I had to return. I was nervous to buy the next half size up because of the narrowness of the boot. I ordered a different style because I have been buying Ariat for years and never had this problem.
review.name: Runs small and tight
comment: We’re sorry to hear we didn’t stack up! We’d really appreciate a chance to connect with you in a more meaningful way on how we can improve. Please email info@ariat.com with additional details on your experience so that we can better assist you.

review.reviewBody: Love, love, love these shoes!! I am typically a size 7 with a medium to wide foot. I opted to go with a 7.5 and they fit great. They are very stylish and well crafted, I look forward to wearing them for years to come.
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody: I loved the look of the boots when they arrived and had ordered my usual size. When I tried them on however, they were too tight and short to wear socks with them.. Luckily when  I called customer service  they had both a half size larger and full size larger in stock. I ordered them both and hope one will fit! The green color rocks!
review.name: Sweet looking boot

review.reviewBody: Very nice well made shoes.  However my feet are a little wide and these didn't work for me.
review.name: Nice shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very pleased with my first purchase of Ariat boots. Bought these for an upcoming trip, with lots of sightseeing so need comfortable/waterproof shoes. These boots were in the top 10 reviewers list. Love the ease of putting the boots on and how they look with my outfits.
review.name: Does not disappoint!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They’re nice boots to just slip on and go for any outfit. I love that they’re waterproof too. I haven’t worn them too much since it’s summer here right now but I’m excited to wear them for the fall/winter
review.name: So cute!

name: Wexford Lug Waterproof Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear PCT 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PCT 55L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear PCT 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PCT 55L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear PCT 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The pockets are well designed and make sense!  The pack fits nicely and adjusts easily.  It is about perfect for overnight pack trip.
review.name: Quality pack with all the right moves

review.reviewBody: Just picked one of these up and it’s a great pack. Done two backpacking trips since buying it with about 30lbs and this pack handled it beautifully. Adjustable shoulder straps makes for a great fit and plenty of features to accommodate all my gear and water bottles. Excellent pack.
review.name: PCT 55L

review.reviewBody: I'll rate this 10/10 for comfort, convenience and features. I've owned many packs and this one is the most comfortable by far. The material is durable. Everything is well though out and things inside are easily accessible. The side pockets are a joy to use. I just could not take the constant squeaking when hiking. I returned it reluctantly, because there is so much to like about this product.
review.name: Great backpack but unacceptably noisy.

review.reviewBody: The pack is yet to be used, but will be a couple times soon.   There is a 'fatal flaw' in the design of the day pack bladder holder.  Customer service was unable to grasp it and/or give me a straight answer.   The day pack is a roll top like a dry bag. In that design MHW forgot about HOW the bladder hose would EXIT the day pack to the user.  The only options, from my perspective not MHW, is to either cut a hole in the day pack (immediately voiding any warranty) or leaving the top open, which interferes with how it attaches to the main pack.  I exclusively use a bladder for hydrations so I'm struggling with whether I want to use this pack at all now.  Another more minor flaw is the sewing on the hip belt.  It was not finished well and missed by Quality Control on the particular pack I received.  There is a ROUGH part that I am hoping gets used to smooth, but we'll see as it touches directly to my person and may cause a hot spot and chaffing.  Now that I'm done complaining about it.  The design features are great.  It, in theory, met what I needed, and I'm eager to try it.   Not  sure how I'll use my 3 ltr bladder though.   I can't recommend this pack at this time, but I own it and will have to deal with it and see...
review.name: So much potential, but design problems.

review.reviewBody: This pack is everything I wanted. Super comfortable, lots of pockets, very versatile. However, it is the noisiest pack I've ever owned. I'm hoping it will quiet down after breaking in, but after a year it's still noisy. Are there any tricks to break it in and quiet the rustle/creak of fabric?
review.name: Perfect except very noisy.

review.reviewBody: Superb design and construction!! A real innovative backpack. Beautiful product!
review.name: Best backpack

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, light and tons of features in this pack. The side water bottle pouches are my favourite feature by far. The hip belt has a pocket that comfortably fits an iPhone, and includes a small day pack on the inside. I liked this bag so much in the 55L which are very well allocated space, that I bought a smaller day pack in this line as well.
review.name: So many great features

review.reviewBody: Great pack, could use an interior zipper pocket. Side pockets were perfect for easy access to water, snacks and maps
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody:
After trying out around a dozen backpacks, I ultimately settled on this pack due to how well its constructed and how comfortable it is when loaded with weight. I am yet to take it on a long trip, but I have confidence it will remain comfortable on a multi-day drip. 

After trying so many backpacks, it came down to this bag, and the Gregory paragon 58. Though the paragon was slightly more comfortable, it is made with flimsy fabric doesn't seem like it would last very long or take abuse from the trail very well. 

One thing I would change about the PCT 55 is the hydration reservoir pocket, which doubles as a day pack. This part of the bag is sort of clunky and not the easiest to deal with. I would rather have a traditional hydration reservoir pocket on the bag. A little disappointing, but not a deal breaker.

Along with this, the pockets on the hip belt don't seem large enough to be practical, but the comfort and the durability of the rest of the bag makes it seem as though its worth the sacrifice, especially since this bag has such large side pockets where things can be stuffed. 

This seems like a durable bag that will last me decades, not to mention Mountain Hardwear has a great repair shop for their products if they happen to break or wear down prematurely.
review.name: Well Constructed Pack

review.reviewBody: Freaking love the size and just how it's put together. Haven't had a chance to put it to use yet but just from how it feels and packs I'm happy with it.
review.name: Great pack

name: PCT 55L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ikos TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really liked the little details and product quality! It does weight a bit more for Backpacking but it works perfectly if it gets shared in tandem ! Main purpose i got SeatoSummit is for Canoe Camping trip ! And worth the price ! Only con - foot prints to be bought separately
review.name: Quality to perfection!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this tent on a gravel bike trip in Wyoming and Montana. I didn’t have to pack it on my bike-it was carried on a van. This tent is easy to set up. I loved that it has 2 doors and how spacious it is. It has lots of pockets for storage. Im happy with my purchase of this tent!
review.name: Just Tara

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this tent for my teen age daughter. She likes to camp and her old tent was just worn out and not worth repairing. So far we have been lucky and have not experienced any severe weather so i cannot attest to how this tent holds up in the wind or rain. Its sets up quickly and looks to be very sturdy. The rain fly is good and large. I like that the screens on the sides of the tent are well above the ground. This should prevent wind blown rain for making its way in like it does on tents where the screen is lower to the ground. The top vents zipper closed but i have to wonder if there is still not a chance of wind blown rain entering at the top of the tent. I guess we will just have to wait and see.

The zippers work very well. The tent is very roomy for a two person tent. 

So far my only suggestions for improvement are to make the compression straps on the bag go all the way around the bag so they are not dependent on the stitching and add a carry handle. Other than that I am very satisfied so far.
review.name: Sturdy Tent.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm lost of words with how many setups this tent is capable of my favorite is the hangout mode my family love it when we're outside at parks, picnics, or just blocking the sun outside
review.name: Absolutely lovely!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We purchased this tent after our lovely loyal LLBEAN 3 person needed to retire. It’s a great design, lots of headroom, handy inner pockets and loops, helpful colour coding. For some reason there was a leak happening during our first 2 outings. I reached out and true to their work a replacement fly was sent. I still wonder why the first one leaked, one of life’s mysteries I guess. Many thanks Sea to Summit for your support
review.name: Beautiful tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s a tent right? Nothings changed with tents since the 90’s, however sea to summit managed to do it, the tent is more roomy and multi faceted whether it be a quick shelter an open bug shelter or a bomb proof tent. I used it for my motorcycle road trip and it kept me out out of the weather. Easy set up tall walls and one happy camper! I would recommend.
review.name: Great tent!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The tent is built with amazing material, it is sturdy and looks very durable while also being fairly lightweight for it’s materials.

I had read online that they had hd a water infiltration during a storm I. Patagonia while trying it out. I assumed the storm they had was something else and that it was not likely to happen here in the US.

The first time I tried it out, we got stormy weather and a lot of rain - I was so excited to camp in the rain. But quickly, the water started coming in. We had a lot of rain, but it was a pretty standard storm for northern canada and Vermont . The rain came through the air vent (as pictured on one of the photos) and was leaking steady on our sleeping bags all night. We ended up having to place a towel (pic) under that closed and zipped vent to stop the leak. In the morning, there was a lot of condensation on the rain cover of the tent that was also leaking through the bug fly (which is the only fabric between un and the rain cover of the tent). No need to say I was disappointed. 
I have however contacted customer service and, as usual, STS service is incredible. They are currently evaluating the tent and will let me know in the upcoming week if it is a design fault or something with the specific tent I received.
review.name: Great tent, but failed to keep dry during storm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Ikos - TR2 is a great tent with an awesome design and effective tarp. Two people are able to comfortably sit up in the tent because of the unique design allowing for ample headroom. A cargo loft keeps small items off of the tent floor, and the venting is appreciated. Lightweight and compact, it fits into a duffle bag, with sleeping bags, pillows, kitchen and clothing for two! Perfect for car or airplane travel.
review.name: Fantastic tent for travel and backpacking.

name: Ikos TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

hasVariant.name: Telos TR3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Telos TR3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was sold on the flexibility and roominess of this tent in a lightweight package. This is my 6th tent and by far my favorite. Set up is easy and it performs well in cold, wet, or clear skies. Looking forward to more backpacking and camping adventures in this tent!
review.name: Telos 2P Tent - flexible, tall, lightweight

review.reviewBody: This is another SeaToSummit outstanding product! I went from camping in heavy Kodiak Canvas to a tiny Telos TR2 - Two Person Freestanding Tent. This tent is incredibly light weight and suitable for air travel. It conveniently packs up into 3 small stuff sacs that are provided. Freestanding is great, especially when you're trying to set up on a wood platform. Most of my camping is during the summertime months or in warm climates. I brought this with me down to the USVI and the screens gave me plenty of airflow. I had zero issues with moisture. Personally, I do miss the optional zip up and down windows. I think that option would afford an individual a bit more privacy and night time warmth. As of yet, I haven't personally tent camped during a heatwave.
review.name: Telos TR2 - Two Person Freestanding Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took it out beach camping. The online instructions are very much needed bc the paper manuals are useless for construction of the tent. Not very intuitive and I've built a lot of tents. Ventilation was good, and very spacious. I think I could set it up now in like 5-10min. One big factor is trying to figure out the tents orientation. All the extra vertical space of the tent makes it strange trying to find the center.
review.name: Excellent tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent replaces a well-worn SD Clip Flashlight. The Telos is about the same weight, a bit less bulk but considerably roomier on the inside both floorspace and headroom-wise. Important consideration is that the Telos is free standing whereas the CF absolutely had to be staked out. Not a big deal on a forest floor or meadow but much of our useage is streamside, sand and gravel bars. As usual, Sea to Summit's design and engineering is thoughtful and innovative, down to simple things like color coding parts and the modular stuff sack. These guys make crazy good stuff!
review.name: Great shelter at minimum weight and bulk

review.reviewBody: This is a very nice tent. Very lightweight, but seems very durable. It's a great size for two people (I suppose that technically three people can fit, but that seems a stretch). I really like how tall it is and the big doors and vestibules on each side is very handy. We haven't used the tent in any kind of rain yet.
review.name: great tent!!

review.reviewBody: This tent worked perfectly. I took it on a week long canoe trip in Maine last week. Had a mix of weather conditions. Two nights dropped to freezing with a heavy frost. One night had heavy rain. The fly cinched down very nicely and nothing got wet. Tent is super light and packed nicely into one of my dry bags. Once set up it was very sturdy in the wind and rain. Im 6 ft tall and liked the wide area for head room and I didn’t have issues getting in and out. I would definitely recommend buying the ground tarp which actually attaches to the tent frame itself so there was no slippage and nothing hung out with the rain. I also got the gear loft which was nice for me because I always seem to loose things while sleeping. Overall I would definitely recommend.
review.name: Excellent tent

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The tent has lots of thoughtful features that improve the experience compared to other tents, particularly the light bar and the gear bags that double as stuff sacks. Only been used once so I can't comment on long term usage, but so far I'm very happy with the purchase. The guy lines are also incredibly easy to use, although I'm curious how long they will last. 

What keeps it from five stars is the stakes aren't as durable as I would've liked (wife bent one the first time using), and the hangout mode setup is not practical for a single person in anything but dead still wind, a slight breeze makes this thing difficult.
review.name: The tent has lots of

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The nicest feature of the Telos TR-3 is large door on each side, with vestibule for shoes and packs. plenty of room for two, would not attempt to use for three. Taking the wet tent down in rain, rowing in the rain all day, setting it up again in the rain, even then I was able to stay mostly dry. I learned it's important to keep the fly taut and the ground tarp tucked in a bit, as when taking the tent down I found a pool of water between the tent floor and the tarp, but even then the tent floor kept my gear dry. The lightweight gray anodized stakes provided aren't sufficient for use in sand, so I brought along about 5 pounds of antique steel stakes, and added my own reflective red guy lines to keep the tent stable in the wind. While I like the neutral gray color of the tent, it would be better to have some brighter colors for the stakes, guy lines, tie-down points, and stuff sacks.
review.name: The nicest feature of the

review.reviewBody:
Easy set-up and breakdown, quality material, very roomy for 2 people. Invest in the footprint and the $20 gear loft - which should be included honestly. 

This tent right there with the BA Copper Spur 2.
review.name: Fantastic Tent

review.reviewBody: There are a lot of great features to this tent, truly innovative. It's very light, about what my old one person tent was (though I carried more stakes than this came with). The tension ridge design is excellent, truly giving peak head room all the way across the tent. The dry setup is handy, the pockets great. On the iffy side is the packaging, which makes it easy to divide the tent in two for sharing the load backpacking. There is zero room for anything extra, like a footprint which is recommended, and is not totally solid when carried as one piece. Strapping it to the outside of your pack might be sketchy. The negative was that in very heavy rain it leaked through the roof vent, right at a seam, and dripped much of the night. It stays dry in light rain, and would for a brief heavy rain, and the roof vent does wonders for eliminating condensation, but in a long heavy rain we were wet. It also seemed very narrow for a 3 person tent, with two 30" pads just barely squeezing in on the wide side. There may be some way to solve the leak, like orienting the tent so the vent is downhill, but it's at the head end so that's tough. A great tent if you don't plan to use it in heavy all night rain.
review.name: Nearly my perfect tent

name: Telos TR3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Hyperlite Mountain Gear Ice 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ice 55L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hyperlite Mountain Gear Ice 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've used this for a couple of winters in the CO rockies as well as a few trips elsewhere, including the french alps. I've also used this a handful of times for backpacking in other seasong. Whether I'm strapping snowshoes or my tent to the back of this bag, I have a place for everything. I love both of my hyperlite bags, and I wouldn't consider another brand after my experience with the gear and the customer service. 
I've had no issues with this bag so far, but my older daypack had a buckle break. They quickly sent a replacement.
For me, this bag handles every situation where I need more than a daypack, and it does so very well. It's expensive, but the material is tough and light. I've spend plenty of time on rocks and strapping sharp and pointy things to the bag without any tears or visible damage. I still love that this is less than half the weight of my former overnight bag with a little extra capacity. Plus, you can just not roll the top if you need even more space. 

I love this bag and this brand!
review.name: Great in the snow and general overnights

name: Ice 55L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I purchased these in Oatmeal, for a recent trip to Iceland. I wore them every day, except for one when I wore my Bogs ARCATA COZY PLAID boots. The Holly Rain boots were perfect for long days of hiking, glacier walking, or shopping. Stylish, warm and comfortable. I also strapped on Crampon Ice Cleats as well as spikes for the glacier. They still look new...the dirt and marks wiped right off. To say I am thrilled with this purchase is an understatement.
review.name: Stylish, warm and comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Holly Rain Lace Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The Holly Rain Lace up Bogs are super trendy. They have the lace up look but the side zipper makes them easy to put on. I like that the zipper fits around a larger size ankle, and the oatmeal color is so pretty. Being water proof makes them perfect for the rainy spring months. Plus, they are easy to clean!
review.name: Convenient and trendy

review.itemreviewed: Holly Rain Lace Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good "Combat" style shoe. A bit more narrow than other boots in the same category of rain boots from bogs but a good fit.
review.name: Great style boot for rain

review.itemreviewed: Holly Rain Lace Tall Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bogs never miss when it comes to heel/bottom of the foot comfort. So squishy, but supportive. These remind me of combat boots but are waterproof all the way up. I'm not always a big fan of having to tie these kinds of boots, so I love the zipper. They did feel a little tight/stiff on the top of my foot when I first wore them, but playing with the tightness did seem to help a little. Fairly true to size, maybe a little bit big.
review.name: Comfortable boots, sneakily waterpoof

name: Holly Rain Lace Tall Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Spyre SLC Mechanical Flat Mount Disc Brake Caliper
review.reviewBody: 2018 Giant Contend SL that had a unique Giant Hydraulic set-up.  I ran Jagwire brake cabling and installed these calipers.   Process was quite straightforward, but did require re-adjustment of the cables as they stretched and allowing the pads to seat to the discs.  Once all set, I have excellent stopping power, and based on this, I am not convinced of the need for hydraulic brakes for road bikes.  I find mechanical brakes easier to work with, but it is noted that as the pads wear, one will need to manually adjust/advance the pad placement.  Whereas, hydraulics have the pistons advance as the pads wear.
review.name: Hydraulic to Mechanical Disc Brakes

review.itemreviewed: Spyre SLC Mechanical Flat Mount Disc Brake Caliper
review.reviewBody:
Pros: 
-I can use my 11 speed mechanical brifters with zero issues with these 
-It's easy to swap shifters if need be 
-Easy to set up 
-Zero rotor rub 
-Much easier to fine tune the pad clearance and modulation IMO 
-DON'T HAVE TO BLEED THEM!!!

 Cons: 
-Not trendy
-Not flashy
-Won't be helping the two big S companies make loads of money off you  (maybe this is a plus)
-Not a closed system, so may accumulate dirt/grime affecting performance

I
review.name: I love mech disc brakes

name: Spyre SLC Mechanical Flat Mount Disc Brake Caliper

review.reviewBody: The bibs were comfortable at first (purchased Mar 2023), but the padding began to fall apart after about 1500 miles of riding.  The straps were flimsy and would curl often, I was very unimpressed.  I've had better luck with Assos and PEARL iZUMi.
review.name: Comfortable at first

review.reviewBody: Santini is a brand that definitely doesn't get the attention it deserves. The Unico bib is hands down one of the best pair of bibs that I have ever used. On the surface, there isn't much to set it apart from other bibs, but the combination of the small details is what makes the difference. The lack of seams on the legs of the bibs help them to disappear into the ride. The Chamois provides excellent long term support and comfort. The bib straps stretch comfortably over your shoulders and lay flat without bunching. These are a pair of bibshorts that you forget about while wearing them, never distracting you from your ride. I couldn't recommend them more.
review.name: Lightweight, minimalist, and Comfortable

name: Unico Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Alpine Light 50L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine Light 50L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Alpine Light 50L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine Light 50L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Alpine Light 50L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pack is super light and good, minimal features. The white color looks good (at least when new) but doesn't make sense. Using this in snow and ice (its intended purpose) means it can more easily get lost if you were to drop it or be stuck in a blizzard, and if someone is looking for you after an accident, it will be more difficult to find you. The color choice seems to be mimicking dyneema fibers (which can't be dyed and are white by necessity), but these packs are made of nylon, not dyneema. The pack carries well considering how light it is. I Have some durability concerns. After 1 climbing trip, there is already a small hole in the fabric at the bottom corner of the frame, presumably from scrambling over and down rocks. Lastly, the ice tool attachments have multiple issues: the metal tool clip at the bottom works fine but feels like the elastic cord holding it in place could break and it is connected to the other side, so you could potentially lose both tools if it snapped and it makes it more difficult to repair. Also, the top cord attachement for ice tools attaches to the shaft in 2 separate ways, one is very insecure and can just pop off (possibly sending your tool down the mountain; mine popped out of the top attachment and swung down/flipped over, luckily didn't come off); the other shaft securing option is to put the shaft through the loop of cord and tighten it with the spring loaded clamp. This is more secure but the spring clamp is not strong enough and it gradually loosens until the shaft is moving around by a few inches on the back of your pack.
review.name: Good pack with some room for improvement

name: Alpine Light 50L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Great rubber, feels very precise on the wall. Not recommended for wide feet though. Had to go up a full size from my usual. 
However, tech specs are great!

review.name: Great edging, hooking, and sticky rubber.

review.reviewBody: Way too small, had to return. Would probably go up half a size or more from street shoe.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality shoe for indoor climbing, however, sizing is way off. Also in my opinion it’s not suited for outdoors. So two stars off for those reasons
review.name: Carries its weight

review.reviewBody: great shoe i have ever wore one reccommend to every people
review.name: recommend for everyone

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These climbing shoes stick like lively glue! Love em
review.name: Glue-like

review.reviewBody: I got the shoes at the end of Nov. last year for my son. He started to climb in last July. He heard a lot great things for this brand name and wanted a pair better than his entry level shoes. He is currently climbing indoor at V7-V8 level, 2-3 times a week. After 3 month regular use, the rubber already started to break at the front. One shoe has a hole, the other has a long line of cracks. I understand the running shoes need to be replaced much sooner than regular shoes. But I did not expect that it only lasted for 3 months. At this cost, I might need to try other brands.
review.name: big name but not last long

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really sticky, really aggressive, really narrow.
Great shoe if you enjoy climbing on the ceiling. Neat idea, kinda unique shoe.
After 4 sessions they are finally starting to break in.
I went with my street shoe size. If I was going to order again I would maybe 1/2 size up.
Even so, these are best for narrow feet.
My feet are wide, ymmv.
review.name: Really sticky, really aggressive, really narrow.

review.reviewBody: All climbing shoes are uncomfortable anyway so it doesn’t matter anyway
review.name: Climbing shoes

review.reviewBody:
3rd pair. I have worn 100's of different climbing shoes over the years and these stand out as one of the best.

The Stealth C4 rubber awesome. Haven't found a better rubber since they started making it decades ago.  Noticeably stickier than the Vibram options and it doesn't wear out quickly. I have Scapas and Spotivas and the tip wears much quicker. Even as it is wearing, it doesn't get all bumpy. It sort of wears sooth. The rubber also doesn't fold at the pressure points when standing on micro edges. A lot of softer rubbers bend and feel insecure on tiny holds. 

The fit of the shoe is on the narrow side but the shoe is extremely soft and expands easily to form a suction cup around my foot. Everyone has a different foot shape and how they like their shoe to feel wrapped on their foot. These are a sock. Though they are super soft, there is a structure and the shoe is almost glued to my foot. It doesn't roll laterally, or slip forward when pulling in on steep toe pulls, or or back when heel hooking. I wear them super tight. Like v3 hard to pull on the first few times, but they do open up and get easier to get on. But for me, having the super snug fit is what I want in any performance shoes. I never size them to be worn around walking at all. I have other shoes for warming up and easier climbing. My street shoe is 9.5 and I get these in a 9. I could do a 9.5 and still have it perform well but in the 9 the juice is worth the squeeze. - I am a 41.5 in Scarpa Instinct and 40 in Sportiva Solutions for comparison. I guess if you have a wide foot, these aren't the best choice. 

These shoes do edge really well for me. I need to feel what my feet are on to be confident on a hold. So, I prefer softer shoes. Even for trad and not super steep climbs. If you don't want to feel the holds, this is not the shoe. They smear amazing. toe hook amazing. I have worn the "no edge" shoes a lot and think these work similar but better all around. The HA Pro Comp do have a fairly aggressive toe down profile and fit. Which is a must for harder, steeper climbing. Even though it is aggressive, it feels comfortable and keeps it's suction throughout the life of the shoe. Probably because of the way the rubber is wrapped and pushes the toes forward and locks in the heel. 

I could go on but basically there are the best so far for me. If you ever wore the 5.10 Teams, these are a better version.
review.name: 3rd pair. One of the best shoes ever.

name: Hiangle Pro Climbing Shoe

Buy the Therm-a-Rest NeoAir Venture Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: NeoAir Venture Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest NeoAir Venture Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My first sleeping pad for camping and I found it to be incredibly comfortable. Valve is great for adjusting firmness for comfort. Great for side sleepers.
review.name: Incredibly Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and easy to use. The surface is quite slippery and I find blankets easy go missing in the night. Overall a very sound night's sleep, with exceptional temperature regulation
review.name: A - 1 Highly luxurious

review.reviewBody: Although the description of the NeoAir labels this pad as self-inflating, it is not.  I don't know how Therm-a-Rest can even remotely claim that as a feature of this pad.  It comes with a "pump sack" which is a nylon sack (about the size of a sleeping bag stuff sack) that attaches to the valve.  Closing the top of the sack and rolling it toward the valve pushes air from the sack into the pad.  You can also blow it up manually.  I haven't used it in the field yet, but it seems like it will be comfortable for 3 season use.
review.name: Beware, it's Not Self-inflating!

review.reviewBody:
I?ve used many different pads over the years and tried several new ones in the last few months. This includes much thicker pads of various types. 

Using them sometimes on hard surfaces, such as tile floors, or worse. 

I thought this would be terrible when I first took it out of the package. 

But, so far it is the best I?ve found. And I did not have the noise issues done have mentioned (though I believe them!) I only noticed the noise at first. I am a light sleeper who usually wakes up frequently.
review.name: Sleeping pad trials

review.reviewBody: I was looking for just a simple, inflatable pad. Decided to go with this Thermarest and got the shortest option (medium), as it was cheapest and I'm only 5'1. FYI, the medium size is definitely small! at 66" (5.5'), I would not suggest it if you're any taller than me (it's also a bit narrow, which I don't mind since I don't move around much while I'm sleeping). For a 5'1 person, it works great. It's also no big deal, in my opinion, that this pad does not have the self-inflating feature??it's very easy to blow up. I didn't even see that it said "self-inflating" in the tech specs before purchasing. This pad is lightweight, only 1-2 R-value, and packs up pretty small. Although best as a summer pad, could definitely use this with a good sleeping bag and an extra layer under me during the colder months. Overall a good purchase.
review.name: Medium Size Venture Pad

review.reviewBody: The mat is ok... too noisy.  TWO holes in it already and I used it two times only.  Please include MORE PATCHES because you will need them if you dont want to turn around and head back home because the mat is punctured. I would not buy again.
review.name: used it 2 times only

review.reviewBody: The quality looked fine but this sleeping pad is NOT self-inflating even though the website is labeling it as such. Not what I thought I was buying.
review.name: Mislabeled - Not Self-Inflating

review.reviewBody: The mat may be fine but the product descriptions states that it has a self inflating valve.  It does not have a self inflating valve and customer service confirmed the description is incorrect.
review.name: Does NOT self inflate

review.reviewBody: I am disappointed. I bought this sleeping pad four months ago and started to use it on the Pacific Crest Trail on last April. I did not use it on the whole period and still two days ago I would always woke up on the ground on a deflated mattress. Afters hours on checking any tiny hole and putting it in the water I've found a micro spot and used the repair kit but nothing have worked. I am now on the trail in the middle of nowhere and nothing to sleep on :(
review.name: I would never buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Inexpensive for what it is, R1.8 is definitely summer but could be used for spring in some regions. Used this in 2C Deg for a few nights, I wasn't cold, but definitely cooler to the touch versus my coupled NeoAir All Season (R4.9). Packs well, and light enough to carry easily.
review.name: Easy to carry, can be used for shoulder season backpacking

name: NeoAir Venture Sleeping Pad
NeoAir Venture Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: I will reiterate what the other reviewer said.  After years of wearing cheap waders that were not so comfortable I got these.  The fit is great.   They stretch enough to form a bit to the movement of your legs.   There are great pockets and compartments that seal up watertight to store your phone and gear.  And best off they are not horribly hot and uncomfortable.   So far used them a week in Colorado in variable depths.
review.name: Love these Waders

review.reviewBody: Love these waders! Just getting into fly fishing and so far these waders have been everything I could have wanted. They fit well while offering a full range of motion, and are still 100% water tight. Lightweight enough to move easy and hike to and from the car to the river.
review.name: love them

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this device 3 weeks now. I work for a home health company that requires lots of travel to rural areas! I have yet to drop any calls in areas where I constantly dropped calls before. It makes me more efficient at my job and setup was a breeze. I use the magnetic mount on another dash mount phone holder and it seems to do well but everytime I hit a bump it changes position. Very minor detail especially since I use the hands free.

review.reviewBody: I'm a storm chaser in Northcentral PA and had looked into reliable cell phone boosters for a while and decided to get the Sleek to see if this would help get more cell signal! It worked great up until a couple months ago. weBoost customer service was fantastic in replacing nearly 5 or 6 of the phone cradles due to a design defect that allowed the internal gears to cut power wires, and quickly sent out a new cradle. The defect was finally figured out and fixed and I then received one that was designed correctly and worked great! Unfortunately, now that my warranty ran out it appears as though my main unit has failed, or at least quit working. I've used the app and there is no improvement in reception in poor cell areas when using the booster. I followed the directions multiple times over the last two months (just in case I did something wrong) while using the app and still nothing. While there is power to the unit and the cradle (white light turns on when plugged in) there is no improvement in my cell reception. In my area and as a storm chaser, reception means my safety. No reception means no radar, no comms and no way of uploading my media content, which means no way of working! I have tried rerouting my booster in my vehicle, even placing my outside antenna in a different spot on my roof with no difference. I like using the cradle so I still use an old one that I cut off the wire on. I'm in the market for a different booster as I've unfortunately not heard back after two attempts at emailing weBoost. Again, I understand my warranty ran out and I don't expect a free unit but I'm surprised (maybe I shouldn't be?) this quit working as quickly as it did. I think this unit worked good for how small it is. It was able to get me service when I needed it, but in combination of the initial issues with the phone cradles and now the main unit not working and not hearing back from anyone, I can only give this product 2 stars. I'm now in the market for a new, more powerful cell booster to help keep me connected while chasing natures most violent weather!
review.name: Small and Easy To Use But Didn't Last Long

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful, sleek setup. Helmet fit is great. And it's true, the visor affords better peripheral vision than traditional goggles. That said, two issues that could break the deal: when it's snowy, the snow/ice comes into the visor and crusts it over. It's truly unusable in inclement weather, which you have to expect on nearly any day on the slopes. Other issue, the ear padding is so thick it's very difficult to hear conversation. I wanted some coverage for foul weather so ended up ripping out the padding while keeping the basic padding cover.
review.name: Not for snowy weather

review.reviewBody: Winter inevitably comes. Along with it is the need to continue riding the bike. The classic summer bike helmet just doesn't work in the wintertime as it's just too full of holes for ventilation. Enter the Smith Survey Snow helmet. It has enough ventilation to keep the visor from fogging, but not enough to make your head cold. It has better protection than ANY bike helmet. It keeps your ears warm without blocking exterior sounds. The flip up visor allows you to lift it up when needed even if you wear glasses like I do. The bright white color provides good riding visibility. In short, it's the best winter bike helmet I have found so far. Thanks, SMITH
review.name: GREAT winter bicycle helmet!!

review.reviewBody: I loved this helmet the first two days we were skiing, then it started to snow. The vents in the top of the helmet allow snow in, a lot of snow. I had about an inch of snow in my goggles and could not ski. I ended up putting bandaids over the top of the holes, but that didn’t allow any venting. Very poor design. I wanted to love this helmet. If your using it for sunny no snow days, it’s great, but I’m not going to travel with two helmets z
review.name: Holes let snow in

review.reviewBody: I purchased this helmet in December of 2023 thinking the integrated googles would work well. The first time on the hill while it was snowing, snow entered in from the sides and completely filled up the inside of the goggle. This helmet with integrated google works great on blue bird days but when it's snowing out it's worthless.
review.name: Avoid if Skiing when it snows

review.reviewBody: Returned because of fit. Since goggles can’t be adjusted, it didn’t work for me.
review.name: Not a good fit

review.reviewBody:
I wear glasses! I bought this hoping I wouldn’t get fogged up anymore.

Yes, I no longer have fogged glasses.
Yes, it fits small. I wear medium and bought a large.
Yes, try it on and make sure it fits your face and glasses.
Yes, the product is comfortable
Yes, I ski in Tahoe, during some bad storms this year it worked well.
Yes, smith has a great warranty and support.


No,
Yes, some snow might get in between you helmet and forehead. Wear a thin head covering.
Yes, it doesn’t seal perfectly around your face like goggles.
Yes, replacement visors are a thing if you can find them.
Yes, smith seems to struggle with supply chain for replacement lenses.
review.name: I wear glasses!

review.reviewBody: Love the photochromatic lens. Super light helmet barely feels it is on. I added the Aleck nunchucks and it sounds great. A couple of improvements points. (a better protection for the lens when stowed away, maybe a whole helmet rigid case or a rigid cover for the lens. Also, the earmuffs out pressure on the ears when using with the audio system.
review.name: Great System, Get the photochromatic lens.

review.reviewBody: Lens fogs up easily and is hard to wipe. I LOVE the flip down design!
review.name: Lens fogs up easily and

review.reviewBody: The goggles don’t click easily down and hold in position. I do like the transition or graduated lenses
review.name: Smith helmet

review.reviewBody: Pretty close to perfect. Clear vision. Good range of view. Seems like a quality product. Figuring out different ways to adjust helmet so goggles tighten to face.
review.name: Happy I took a chance.

name: Survey Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I’ve been climbing in these shoes for months, 3 days per week on average. Since I started wearing these shoes I have been climbing pain free in my feet. I bought these on the recommendation that they might be a solution for bunion pain and I couldn’t agree more. When it comes to performance, I think they hit the mark and can certainly get the job done. I primarily use them for sport climbing.
review.name: Say goodbye to bunion pain

review.reviewBody:
My street size is 45. I ordered 45 assuming that they run small. 44.5 would be a better fit. The 45s are snug but not tight and the heel slips ever so slightly. If they stretch at all they might get a little too large, though I think the straps will compensate.
My first time out with them was at a local quarry. These did exceptionally well on edges and pockets. I struggled to get up a slab and switched to my tried-and-true 5.10s. The Force V sole is too thick and stiff to effectively smear on really small slab features. But, to be fair, that's not what these shoes are designed for.
I expect these will be become my go-to shoe for gym lead climbing. They edge well, the pointed toe should be good for pockets, the slightly aggressive downturn will be good on overhangs, the sole is sticky if not especially sensitive, and they're comfortable to wear for hours. I do wonder how they'll heal hook, though. Might have wished I had ordered the 44.5s.
review.name: Good General Purpose

review.reviewBody: Switch out between my LaSportiva shoes
review.name: Fit well

review.reviewBody:
I use this as a warmup shoe in the gym, but it is really versatile outdoors.  I got a 42.5, a somewhat comfy fit, have used them outdoors for granite single pitch and multi.  Comfy, durable leather, nice padding and split tongue, jams most crack sizes well.  No pressure I had them resoled with XS Grip for more smearing ability.  They work fine for sport, but do not edge closely, or pull or hook as well as a slipper or downturned shoe.  Sensitivity is not great, but the Force is solid on longer crack and face routes.
Scarpa rock shoes are def. snug for their Euro sizing.  I'm about size 9.5 US street shoe, or 42.5, but Scarpa's 42.5 feels a full size smaller.  This is similar to Five-Ten sizing, yes?  They are both about a full Euro size smaller than La Sportiva rock shoes.
review.name: All Arounder

name: Force V Climbing Shoe
Force V Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these around a month ago and as you can guess from the title they were my first pair of climbing shoes. I bought these in true size and at first they hurt really bad to wear but after a week or two they molded to my feet and feel very supportive with little to no pain. I wear them for about 2-3 hours at a time and they’re very comfortable shoes. Although I haven’t been able to wear these outdoors I really love these for recreational climbing and they’re prefect for crack climbing/ aggressive bouldering.
review.name: Great Climbing Shoes but not for noobies

review.reviewBody: The sizing is a bit off compared to the Shamans. I usually wear a 8.5/9 depending on the comfort. I purchased a 9 and they are much smaller than expecting.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I personally love this shoe. As someone who likes a really soft shoe that lets me feel the wall or rock a lot more, this has been the best I’ve come across so far. A super sensitive sole that is also good enough to hold up and not flex when it isn’t needed. The amount of rubber on the toe box is great for toe hooks as well. Overall, so happy with the zenists. This is my second pair and will likely be my main shoe I wear going forward
review.name: Super soft shoe!

review.reviewBody: I have been climbing in my Zenist’s for a long time. The first time I bought them the stitching was all messed up and coming out, the Evolv team was kind enough to send me a new pair. Now these shoes are sensitive, so sensitive that once you get used to them every other shoe will feel like wearing a brick on your foot. They don’t have a ton to offer outdoors but are more than functional. The gym is where they shine, these shoes are bouldering machines. Who needs stiffness for support when you have so much sensitivity that you can just paste your foot over a chip and trust it. I love the easy on and off and the fit, they are durable and have lasted me over two years now. I look forward to trying the zenist pro with the new heel lock and closure system when my current zenist’s blow out. The black and white color way also looks soooo steezy.
review.name: Steez machines

review.reviewBody: Bought these about 4 months ago and I'm still absolutely loving them. They fit me like a glove, though I did have to get ~2 sizes larger than expected, coming from another brand + my street shoes. My previous pair gave me foot cramps after every climb, but I can keep these ones on for a long time with no issue. Every time I expect to slip off a hold, they've got me, and I can't ask for more than that!
review.name: I adore these shoes

review.reviewBody: I use these shoes for warm-ups, bouldering and super long overhang routes because they are super comfy without giving up any performance. Love the sensitivity due to softness so that I can feel every nuance of the rock when I'm toeing down hard, heel hooking or toe hooking. Durable construction means they'll last. Nice work coming up with this design, Team Evolv!
review.name: My Do Everything Well Shoe!

review.reviewBody:
Evolv knocked it out of the park with this shoe
PROS: Very sensitive, phenomenal on board climbing and standing on gym volumes. Works pretty well outdoors surprisingly (but I do still favor the phantoms for real rock), The toe rubber hooks very well, and the construction of the shoe it top notch. 
CONS: The one and only gripe I have is how poorly the heel fits my foot. I thought it was just me, but after talking to about 5 other members at my local gym that have the zenist…..they all have the same complaint! The heel is just SOO baggy and flimsy. 
Sizing:
A nice glove like fit down sizing a 1/2 size from my street shoe with toes fully curled. After one to two sessions the shoe felt broken in fully.
My foot is on the wider side with an egyptian toe shape and a “normal” shaped heel. 
I wouldn’t recommend down sizing any more than a 1/2 size.
review.name: Amazing shoe

review.reviewBody: I loved my zenist, they were painfully tight at first my street shoe size is around 10?5 to 11 and I got 10?5 in them but they did break in. They smeared really well and the toe was really good even tho it wasn?t padded that much they performed better on bathangs than my x1. And one other thing I loved about these shoes was the heel they basically hugged my heel and ankles no dead space in them I would recommend if you are looking for a soft indoor shoe. You can wear them outside but they are so soft that they would wear down quickly if you wear them outside but they can sure take a beating
review.name: Soft and stic

review.reviewBody: If you have a strong enough foot this shoe can do it all! This shoe is soft enough that it works great for smears and volumes, but is supportive enough for me to do whatever I want with my foot. Need to do a toe scum to pull yourself across to a jug? It has you handled! Need to go from an aggressive toe hook to a heel hook? Can handle it with ease! This is my favorite shoe and what I always wear whenever I see a new problem.
review.name: Can do it all

name: Zenist Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I asked around. These poles were highly recommended by many, many PCT thru-hikers. Got a set for my wife. She loves them. “Game changing,” she says.
review.name: I asked around. These poles

review.reviewBody: I plan on doing the Tour du Mont Blanc next year and I purchased these poles for that. I have inspected them and they have the collapsible and adjustable capabilities that I desire. They are great poles and I am looking forward to using them on the trek
review.name: trekking poles

review.reviewBody: This is perfect for backpacking - especially if you're traveling abroad to your backcountry adventures. Easy to store and sturdy on the trail. I am tough on gear, and have broken the carbon fiber ones. These poles can withstand my abuse.
review.name: Packable and light

review.reviewBody: Sadly the newest version of this pole is no good in wet weather country. I had a pair of Distance FLZ for about 7 years and loved them. I tripped over my poles last year and bent one to the point I could no longer use it. I went and purchased the new version of the Z pole. 3 times I have returned them under warranty and received a new pair. The push button used to hold the pole straight and used to release the pole to fold broke on each of the 3 set I used. It took me until my 3rd set of poles to figure out that the poles worked perfectly in dry weather, however after wet hikes, even though I did my best to dry to poles out, the mechanism became stiff and then failed completely. Black Diamon, please fix the change you made so the metal inside survives damp conditions.
review.name: Not Good in Wet Weather Country

review.reviewBody: Light light light weight. However they come apart easily if they get stuck in rocks? Maybe I’m not locking them out properly.
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: Small size, relatively light weight sturdy poles. Went with these for the aluminum construction and ability to adjust length as carbon can be less forgiving if the pole gets flexed too much. Looking forward to future hikes with these.
review.name: Great for Backpacking

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to purchase these poles for a trip to Zion and Bryce Canyon. They did not disappoint! They are nice and lightweight, easy to put together, an break down smaller. The perfect everyday trekking poles and for travel.
review.name: Great lightweight poles

review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace a pair of Alpine FLZ but I wanted something more compact for travel and mountain trekking / running. I did not thought that the carbon premium was a must and I am really satisfied so far. Definitely recommended.
review.name: Great Poles

review.reviewBody: Im totally disappointed with quality of my tekking poles Bd distanze flz aluminium. After 5 days of using them I got issue in both poles with holder on the photo.
review.name: Stay away

review.reviewBody:
These are my first set of trekking poles and I'm very happy with them. I chose this model (Distance FLZ Trekking Poles) based on reviews that described them as quiet and vibration-free and I agree with that assessment. 
They are extremely lightweight and compact, but also feel very sturdy when used. I've taken them on a steep and muddy trail up and down a canyon and felt more sure-footed than ever, especially on the downhills and crossing rocky streams.
review.name: Lightweight and Compact

name: Distance FLZ Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: I wanted a beanie that was soft and not too tight on my head (causes itching).  Simple perfection.

review.reviewBody: Similar to other reviewers, a good beanie that fits your noggin and looks great is rare. This OR beanie is my absolute favorite. Perfect fit, great weight and warmth, and love the look. I throw this in all my hiking packs just in case and never regret it!
review.name: The beanie of all beanies

review.reviewBody: OR threw this in when sending a warrant replacement Fleece. Nice surprise and awesome customer service!
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: Good colour. Comfortable. A bit too close to the eyes for me, have to peel back the rim.
review.name: Nice toque

review.reviewBody: It's warm and I love the color, perfect for casual and active use
review.name: Very Cute

review.reviewBody: Just grabbed the Juneau Beanie from Outdoor Research and it's quickly become my go-to for chilly days. Not only does it keep my head super warm, but it also looks pretty slick with its retro vibe. The fit's comfy for all-day wear, and it's great at wicking away moisture, so no sweaty head issues. Plus, with a bunch of colors to choose from, I'm already thinking about snagging another one. Totally recommend it if you're looking for a solid winter beanie!
review.name: Cozy and Cool: Loving My Juneau Beanie!

review.reviewBody: Awesome, fits my head like a beanie should. It is not too tight around the head, the right length, comfy out of the bag, and cozy
review.name: Great beanie:)

review.reviewBody: Just as expected, fits nicely and good balance between warmth and comfort.
review.name: Perfect for mid-winter

review.reviewBody: Good in all but the coldest weather, this toque quickly became my go to, it's warm and cozy without being to constrictive.
review.name: A great medium weight toque

review.reviewBody: Use this beanie for day hiking, walking the dog. Warm and comfortable.
review.name: Great beanie!

description: Buy the Salomon Highlander Snowboard Binding - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Highlander Snowboard Binding - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Highlander Snowboard Binding - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I hade those bindings for the third season. When buying them I tought it would last a while since it's quite exepensive but some plastic parts a breaking and might make stance adjustement impossible if it keep on falling appart like that. that's unfortunate.
review.name: Comfortable but cheaply made

review.reviewBody: This is my first Salomon binding and I’ve been snowboarding for 30 years. I was skeptical but I was wrong. They’re so comfortable to ride around all day and don’t sacrifice any response. No foot fatigue or crush from the top strap and the shadow flex rear hoop is wild to feel in person.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Got these on a Super 8 Pro and it is a great combination.  The bindings are stiff and responsive, but I believe because of the Kevlar quick wire tech, are also extremely comfortable.

Only thing to watch for is the recommended sizing says M or L will fit 10-10.5. That is not true, I have tried everything to fit my boot, but the toe piece keeps sliding off /:

if you have a 10.5 or smaller go with the medium!
review.name: Absolutely Stellar Binding. Beware of Sizing

name: Highlander Snowboard Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: These are the most uncomfortable boots I've ever worn. I returned this color, but kept two others and now I'm stuck with them.
review.name: Very uncomfortable!

review.reviewBody: Usually wear a women’s 8.5 wide. These fit just about right.  These are snug at the instep if you have “taller” feet; it took a few wears to start to feel comfortable, and takes a shoe horn every time to get them on. Surprisingly roomy at toe box (which is where my width is). Learher and construction seem good. Cork later at the sole makes these a bit more casual, but colorwise, plays well with all the neutrals.  Good looking for a casual boot. Squeaky for first day, then not again. Haven’t tested waterproofing yet.
review.name: Buy a shoe horn, look great

review.reviewBody: These boots fail the basic Chacos test: my feet hurt after less an hour. I have worn pretty much nothing but Chacos for over a decade, as the sandal base supports my feet, and my feet typically don’t hurt. These boots look stylish, but aren’t supportive. Just kind of meh.
review.name: Meh.
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: They didn't fit. Since they didn't fit, I returned them. I think that explanation satisfies the 50 characters required for this review.
review.name: I don't blame Chaco
comment: Thank you for your feedback.

review.reviewBody: Overall, I'm happy with the boots. My biggest complaint is that your feet don't breathe in them, which keeps them from being a 5 star product. The footbed and toe box are quite comfortable.
review.name: Great boot but not breathable

review.reviewBody: Boots looked great but were way too big. I've eorn a 7 for years, just not in this boot. Returned and refunded promptly
review.name: Too big
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Cade.

review.reviewBody: Bought this planning to use for professional settings, had to return. Mainly because this was the squeakiest shoe I’ve ever worn. Couldn’t walk 3 steps without the sound irritating me. But even if that goes away over time, the sole of the shoe looks so strange that I couldn’t wear it in a professional setting. It’s a bummer since the shoe fit great.
review.name: Wildly squeaky, and ugly bottom layer
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: I love these. I was apprehensive at first but they are by far my favorite boots now.
review.name: Great fit and comfortable
comment: Being your favorite is our favorite! Thanks!

review.reviewBody: I am a property developer. I wanted a shoe that was comfortable, looked stylish, yet durable enough to walk around on a retail commercial property construction site. I literally wore these shoes for the very first time this week for 6 days (Monday-Saturday) 8 hours a day and they look like Ive had them for years. They are comfortable, but the crease where my toe bends cracked, and the leather really stretched. I am 5' 11" and 180 pounds. I am not some huge dude. These shoes shouldn't have worn this quickly for the price. I was literally only walking around on gravel. The sole is barely worn.
review.name: Lower Tier Craftsmanship & Durability
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable, easy to get on and off, waterproof, and handsome. I couldn’t ask for much more.
review.name: My new favorites
comment: Thanks Bob! We love being the favorite!

description: Buy the Merrell Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Merrell Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love these hiking boots.  Fits true to size and comfortable without break-in.  I have very wide feet and usually wear 4e when I can get it.  The wide version of Moab feels great.  Also, surprisingly, they are incredibly easy to put on - I can just about step into them without struggling or using a shoehorn.  I was not expecting this -  it is a major selling point! I have taken them on several hikes now, and I feel stable on dirt, loose stone, tree branches, up-hill, down-hill, etc. The mid height is perfect for hiking, and the weight is very reasonable.  I have some much heavier leather boots that aren't as easy to hike with.  I don't really need the waterproofing I think in most cases, so I went the middle route by getting the standard waterproofing and not the gor-tech. This works great for light water exposure and i have yet to feel any moisture get through.  I don't normally write reviews, but I have so much trouble getting boots that fit comfortably due to my foot width.  Most wide shoes are either on a last that doesn't work well with my feel or are only "slightly" wider than normal D width.  Those shoes cause me significant pain, almost from the moment I put them on.  I have no pain walking in these.  The insoles are also pretty comfortable.  Also, these were on sale when I bought them, so I feel like I got a great value.  If you have wide feet and don't like to struggle to put on your boots, just buy these!
review.name: Great fit for wide feet, No shoehorn needed!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been wearing them for 4 years and each new version is good as the prior - they did not lower quality to maintain the price. I am 71 and only hike 6.5 miles every other day around Stone Mt, N.E. Atlanta, but they kept me from twisting my ankle numerous times. I always buy them on sale which makes them an even better deal. Thanks.
review.name: Great Boots Moab 3

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfy shoes. Was a long Hoka wearer and wanted to try something new for rugged/all terrain hiking shoes. Found a bit less comfortable to start with but after a day or two, I started liking them.
review.name: Comfy pair

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been breaking these in on dog walks and at work.  Prepping for a Mighty Five week long trip in March with my 17 year old.  Very comfortable, surprisingly light weight.
review.name: Dog Walk Approved!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots were made for walking. It's December 3rd and we have walked 723 miles so far in 2024. We take our walking seriously and these are the boots that allow me to trek in comfort over both dirt trails and concrete pavement. As a senior retired citizen, I really appreciate how easy these boots are to put on and take off after our morning 3.4-mile walks.
review.name: Comfort, Easy On & Off, Go Anywhere Boots

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have purchased several different hiking boots over the years. Salomon, Keen, Hokas and Altras. I am 5’4”, weigh 120lbs and have a shoe size of 8. I tend to size up and go with a wide for hiking purposes because I like to wear a thicker sock and my foot swells on longer hikes. The mid-rise boot provides excellent support and decent water resistance. I do not require any break in time with the Moab. They are extremely comfortable right out of the box. I do have custom orthotics that I prefer to the insole that comes with the boot, but can go with or without. The boot holds up well to abuse. I hike an average of 5 miles a day. Mostly off trail - scrambling, sand, bushwhacking and rocky terrain. I am able to handle steep descents without my toes hurting.   I have purchased both mid rise and low Moab’s as gifts for friends and family. They all agree that it is a very comfortable choice. I normally wear gaiters to keep as much debris as possible from entering the shoe.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because the boot does not do a very good job keeping sand from entering the boot.
review.name: Hiking boot

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: great boot overall... after a few years, the seams on the sides of the toe eventually unglue and obviously leak... otherwise, great comfort, fit and cushion for working/hiking...

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got them to wear primarily to the shooting range, where the ground is extremely rocky.  With previous shoes, my feet were killing me by the end of the day because I felt the rocks through the bottom of the shoes.  These boots flex well and were strong enough to protect my feet.  They also supported my ankles whenever I walked on the constantly uneven surfaces.
review.name: I walk above and beyond.
comment: Thanks for the great feedback Mike!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had to return them because they were defective.  The fabric on the achilles area was folded over and created a pain spot.  I went out and bought some Danners instead.  I was fine not giving this review, as it was probably an anomoly, but since you asked.
review.name: Defective pair

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots fit the bill perfectly. They are comfortable, provide good traction, and are not bulky. Wore them on a retreat in the SC mountains and they performed very well. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great boots for outdoor activities

name: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Wide - Men's

These boots are light, but appear very big and wide. Definitely size down by 1/2 size. I did not like the overall size, but the look was nice.
review.name: Light but big/wide on the foot

review.reviewBody: I work outdoors and it's been a very slushy and icy winter. These boots are keeping my feet warm and dry. They are very comfortable and the traction is great.
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable! The fit is perfect, my feet are never wet or cold. I'm super happy with my purchase!
review.name: Love my new boots!

review.reviewBody: Bought online as I know the Salomon sizing. Wasn’t disappointed - was quite surprised by the furry lining but it’s very comfortable and another reason I was glad I went a half-size up.Wore them in ice and a bit of snow in Glencoe. Don’t think I’ve ever had such warm feet in such a light boot
review.name: Great waterproof boots

review.reviewBody: I wanted a pair of lightweight boots that were waterproof and so far these have proved perfect. Very comfortable and the sizing is about right.
review.name: Lightweight and waterproof as promised

review.reviewBody: My feet are wide and I was really scared that these shoes would make my 2 week trip to Europe in the winter super uncomfortable. However, they were truly my saving grace. I was so comfortable and it protected me from subzero conditions. My feet never got wet once! 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: The best there is

review.reviewBody:
I bought them a month ago, and they are super useful for the rainy, cold days in Vancouver. I have used them to do short hikes and I am amazed how they don't get very dirty and it is very easy to clean them.

Also I don't get hot when I am using them indoor.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable, you could sleep with them on. That means a lot to me and my feet. I just got them so more on them later, but so far they have my feet very happy. Happy feet happy me.
review.name: comfy! comfy!comfy!!!
