review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love power grid fleece because the fabric is warm but not bulky. A full zip jacket in this fabric is perfect for the cooler days in spring and fall, and I wear it indoors as a sweater in the winter. Mountain Hardwear's jacket has awesome wrist bands with thumb holes and big pockets for phone and glasses.
review.name: Love this Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought one of these for myself and one for my wife. It is a great jacket but has a little room for improvement. Mine fits well except there it is loose at the waist. The jacket would benefit from a closer at the waste to allow you to close it tight when extra warmth is needed.
review.name: Great jacket but could be improved

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not my favorite fabric as I was expecting it to be fleece for some reason.   It does get the job done.  It should work nicely under my windstop jacket even though it’s more of an orange than a red.   I’d recommend this to my friends that are looking for a lightweight jacket.
review.name: Polartec jacket

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this fleece as an active layer for alpine and ice conditions. The power grid gives the material a lot of flexibility while being warm but also breathable. I wear it for my entire ice climbing season and it keeps me plenty warm. I also like that it doesn't need to be washed frequently and the fabric does not smell despite use on long trips. The hoodie comes over my helmet which is a big need met as I don't like wearing beanies under my helmet. Breast pocket zipper is where my phone lives and it's easy to access with gloves on.
review.name: Great performance hoodie!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wishing for the old version of this jacket that was fuzzy, breathable, and warm. Tight in armpits, awkward fit elsewhere, missing that monkey fleece cozy texture from 5-6 years ago and wishing I had bought more of them then, if I had known they'd never bring them back.
review.name: BRING BACK THE OLD VERSION

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bring back the old version from 5-6 years ago. I've been waiting to update my gear. I had hopes this would be the one, but it is not. And MHW gear is always too tight in the armpits.
review.name: Wishing for the older version

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket in December of 2022 and love it! I choose the Vinson Blue Heather color and it's really beautiful. I like how comfortable it is to wear while around the house in our cool PNW climate or at the summit when it gets cooler while on a trip.  I like this jacket so much I had to get a second one in red, the Alert Heather color.  These are somewhat form fitting but not too light for me and super comfortable. I like how long it is in the back. This jacket looks nice you can wear it around town too.

The thickness of this jacket is thinner than the Monkey Woman Grid Fleece jacket.  Which makes it great for layering under down jackets.  The fleece part of the Monkey Woman Grid Fleece is fluffier and thicker than the power grid. But the features are similar. I am still majorly in LOVE with the monkey woman grid fleece also and hope it will come back someday!
review.name: Favorite Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the most comfortable and flattering jacket I have ever owned! It is perfect for biking, hiking, snow sports or just playing outside on a fall day. I’m seriously considering buying a 2nd!
review.name: The PERFECT jacket does exist!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this as an active or at times casual fleece and it is PERFECT. It is a warm season right now and I can't wait for it to cool down so I can wear it all the time. I have not yet used it heavily to be able to comment on durability, but I can say that it feels very well made, solid stitching, quality materials, etc. The details in the design are excellent as well; from the thumb holes in the sleeves to the tightness and shape of the hood, you can tell that it was very thoughtfully designed with an active, outdoorsy user in mind. 

One thing worth considering is the length of the sweater. I suspect is engineered this way to stay under a harness, but I am 5'9" and would be happy with it an inch or two shorter. For shorter folks and/or those with short torsos, it may feel too long depending on your personal preferences.

The sizing feels about perfect. I would say it is a snug large, which is perfect for me as I tend to be smack dab in the middle of the two sizes. My body measurements for reference 40-32/33-40-ish.
review.name: Well-made, well-designed, long active fleece perfect for cooler weather.

name: Polartec Power Grid Full-Zip Hooded Jacket  - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable
review.name: Flannel lined pants

review.reviewBody: These pants run really big. I am usually a medium but ordered a large thinking since they’re flannel lined they might be uncomfortable if they were tight. I contacted Customer Service to exchange to a medium. Backcountry doesn’t do exchanges so you have to re-buy the item and ship the other one back, but I had bought them on sale and wanted to have the price honored. Any way, I was sent another large so all of the waiting for shipping and getting a refund was a huge waste of time.
review.name: Customer service was not helpful

review.reviewBody: So cozy and soft and I want MORE
review.name: I love these pants!

review.reviewBody: These are amazing! I got a small and they fit perfectly. I’m usually a small (26/27 in jeans). So comfy, soft, and warm.
review.name: Comfy and warm

review.reviewBody: I'm so glad I read the comments about them being huge and not good for skinny gals because they are perfect for my big thighs :') trousers never fit me right and these are PERFECT. True over the belly button high waist, space for thighs + butt, super warm and comfy. I usually wear a large in pants but I got a medium and they're perfect, so recommend sizing now. I'm 160lbs / 5'6"
review.name: Finally!!! True high waist pants

review.reviewBody: I have a lot of difficulty finding pants that are the right length & fit on me—especially if they’re lined. If you are on the lookout for a pair of petite/short/curvy fit lined pants these are wonderful! They have plenty of stretch in the waist and hips but also have the adjustable belt if you want them to be fitted. The material is super soft & has a good amount of flexibility so they hold up well to daily work & wear. I loved them so much that I got them in two different colors—they will be a winter staple for me for sure.
review.name: Perfect for petite/short fits

review.reviewBody:
The warmth of the fleece is lovely, so I will give them a point there - the style as well is great with the neat little built in belt.

However, if you are tall and have long legs (I'm 5'8 and about 130lbs), the crouch and in general the fit will be OFF. 

The crouch is MASSIVE, I got a medium and while it laid alright on my ankles, if I were to try to get it to fit, I would need to pull the pants up as the crouch is so large, then the pants are highwaters, and still it won't sit correctly on your hips as it's such a large area, I could fit a watermelon or two in the crouch. 

I really wish they had different sizes and cuts because these could've been perfect!
review.name: Could've been perfect

review.reviewBody: These are incredibly soft material and have been warm so far during cold fall days in PNW. I sized down to a xsmall instead of a small after reading reviews. My waist is 27in, hips 38in. These were initially snug around the waist but fit great after wearing for a little while. I also carefully removed the belt with a seam ripper because it defeated the purpose of the waistband being stretchy in my opinion. I’m 5’4” and they sit right below my ankle. Would buy more for sure.
review.name: So soft, sized down

review.reviewBody: I own a pair of the XXS Stoic non-flannels. Love that it’s a thicker pant for winter but it’s huge in all the wrong places. Looked to get a flannel pair for winter because warmth is warmth regardless of a baggy crotch. Unfortunately flannel model only comes in XS as the smallest and is wayyyy to big for someone 5’1. Which their were accommodating options for people in the 5-5’3 range
review.name: No sizes for smaller builds

review.reviewBody: I'm normally a S in most brands but sized down to XS based on reviews. These fit great and are super comfortable but the length is nowhere near as long as it shows in the model pics. I don't have long legs and these hit right above my ankle unrolled. I'll keep these because I'm mainly wearing them to WFH but bummed because I was looking forward to rolling these up.
review.name: Cute + Comfortable but short

name: Flannel Lined Venture Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loving the shoes so far! Great grip! And the colour is beautiful!
review.name: My new favourite shoe!!

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes are very comfortable and size fits my feet.
review.name: Nice and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Nice shoes for long routes, I recommend salomon brand for trail activities
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought two pairs, the shoes are very light and have good grip.
review.name: Good workmanship

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes are very cost-effective and worth a try.
review.name: Comfortable and lightweight shoes

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Decided to give these a try as my sense ride needed to be replaced after 500+ miles.  I love these!   Right out of the box I did a 10 mile trail run and they felt amazing!  Great response, cushioning and traction!  Have had many runs since then & I am loving them.  So glad I decided to give these a go!  Loved the green & grey color and they caught my eye.  These will be my new go to!  They were great for mixed trail - single track, wider trail, rocks & roots technical climbs and descents.
review.name: My new go to trail shoes

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE this shoe so much, that I ordered a 2nd pair (this one). - though the quality is lacking - after 8 weeks JUST wearing the shoe for comfort (NO RUNNING) - the top fabric is already breaking apart. A super comfortable show for people with Plantar fasciitis but obviously NOT durable
review.name: Great cushion, perfect comfort
comment:
Hello, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.
We apologize in advance for any inconvenience caused. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.
A member of our team will be in touch with you shortly to discuss your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the comfort and grip great as well on almost all surfaces. Please, please move to quicklaces instead of  standard laces. This is a bit of a deal breaker for me as quicklace is more secure and less fuss to adjust on the trails. The colourways could use a bit of work as well. The choices are more road runner. Trail Runners are more about dirt, mud, etc. A little darker colours with a splash of brighter colour would be great. Love Salomon, loyal to the brand, just a few tweaks and a great shoe.
review.name: Glide Max - Super for long trail runs.

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm enjoying this model a lot. Good for easy trails with some gravel and rolling hills, the lugs aren't very deep and would not recommend on a technical trail. The cushioning is more medium than ultra.
review.name: Good, everyday easy trail running shoes

review.itemreviewed: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: After realizing my Hokas were done for and maybe not the best for my hobbit feet especially for long trail runs with rocky sections, I tried Altras (I might as well have been barefoot), read up on a ton of other shoes and models, and finally bought these. They were very comfortable right out of the box and easy to run in. The only downside is I have to tie it in a certain way ie pretty tight not to have my heel feel loose. It does feel though that my feet are sort of sinking into the shoe as the weeks go on, so hopefully that will get better. These seem much better made than a lot of other trail running shoes in terms of the fabric and construction and I’m excited to try more.
review.name: Relieved to have found these after a long search!

name: Glide Max Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Super confortable bibshort. The fabric has a nice feeling, not excessively tight. Perfect fit for me, it doesn’t move at all when riding or standing on the pedals. The pad is really good, right level of padding without being too thick. 
Size L for me, 6f1 and 174 lbs, same sizing as Castelli…
I saw some reviews about the bibshort not being durable,,, I wash my shorts in a mesh laundry bag to preserve them, and hang them to dry: so far so good, they are like new.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
These are perfectly adequate bibs for a short to medium distance casual or training ride.  To be entirely fair to Giordana, if that’s what you want them for, then for sure give them a shot.  There are however, some big differences between these and higher end bibs, whether in the Giordana range, or from competitor brands.

First, the positives.  The chamois itself is quite nice.  It isn’t quite to the level of the FR-C Pro, but is still comfortable and supportive without feeling Iike a diaper.  The fabric for the legs is also comfortable, though again, with a very casual feel.

Big areas of opportunity exist when it comes to the leg grippers, waist band, and bib straps, in my opinion.  The leg grippers are almost entirely ineffective on these bibs and I find myself adjusting the end of the legs multiple times per ride.  The waist band is cut quite a bit lower than some of Giordana’s other bibs, which for me manifests in uncomfortably cutting into my stomach while riding.  Last, but not least, the straps are a very weak elastic material that does not provide any real tension - perhaps if the straps were more robust the wait cutting in wouldn’t be an issue as I generally have to hike the shorts up mid-ride.

It is worth noting that I already own 5 pair of Giordana FR-C Pro bibs and ordered these in the same exact size.  The compression is far lower on the legs and again, the bib straps themselves are far less robust and effective.  Perhaps if I sized down they would be better, but that’s also frustrating to wear different sizes in the same brand.  Ultimately these are nice enough, but even at a reduced price compared to the higher tier FR-C Pro versions I don’t think are worth the money.  There are much better bibs available at the same price point or lower than these.
review.name: Do The Job, But Not My Go-To Bibs

review.reviewBody: My all time favorite bibs!!! They fit me perfectly! I'm 5"9, 140#s and the size small is perfect. Will diffeintly be buying these again.
review.name: Best bibs ever!!

review.reviewBody: Where have these been all my cycling life? These fit great, and they’re not kidding about the chamois, no chamois cream is necessary. My only question at this point is how they’ll hold up over time.
review.name: Live up to the hype

review.reviewBody: These are some of the best fitting and supportive shorts that I own. I would definitely buy another pair.
review.name: Excellent fit and supportive chamois

review.reviewBody: After about six months and probably 40 rides and washes, I'm getting ready to retire this pair. While the chamois held up and is quite comfortable, the fabric simply started thinning in random places. I've had about six pairs of bibs so far and these are the most expensive and comfortable, but also the least durable.
review.name: Comfortable but not sturdy
comment: Same exact thing happening with mine. They wore out quickly in several huge spots which is too bad because I otherwise like everything about them.

review.reviewBody: Pics or it didn't happen, pic included. My best man and I (along with my wife) rode 3 hours to the top of a mountain in Giordana Silverline, got married, and bombed back down. Giordana does clothing right. They do run pretty standard sizing, not euro. I am 5'7" 130 lbs and wear XS.
review.name: So nice you'd wear it to a wedding

review.reviewBody: I have about 25 rides on these and I'm pretty hard on my gear (but delicate when washing). They fit snug but very comfortable. Never had to adjust once I'm on the bike and riding. Will purchase a second pair very soon.
review.name: Well Fitted and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Bought 2 pairs.  Red and blue.  Both pairs got a wear hole in same position on my inner right thigh within a few rides.  Shammy in blue pair entirely detached within 10 or so rides. Very disappointed.
review.name: Wear holes and shammy detached

review.reviewBody:
After wearing Castelli for over 20 years I returned my Castelli that I had purchased from cc two weeks ago  (which ran smaller now than a few years ago) and got a pair of these Giordana Silver line bib shorts in the same size, which is XL  (at the recommendation of a Cc rep who raved about the Giordana silverline)   these fit properly and at trying on feel super comfortable, the flat elastic straps sit flat, opposed to mesh straps which can roll up.

  I love the textured legs and sides on these, they look great and seem to be more durable.  They remind me a bit of upper line Assos models 
      
I've heard from many reviews here, YouTube,  and other places that Giordana silverline are the BEST sub $200 shorts available.  From seeing them I have to agree (so far) from inspecting them in person. 

I'm going to start using them and I will update this review after a few months of using them. 

Btw, I got them in navy blue, I like that there are no loud 1990's logos, they are very good looking,  and much more expensive looking than they are.
review.name: Wow, impressed so far

name: SilverLine Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have wanted these gloves for several years, and with the sale, I finally pulled the trigger. These are by far the most comfortable gloves I have ever worn in my entire life. The unique lining is soft and incredibly warm. The retro cinch straps work great, and the gloves are a beauty to behold.  I haven't put them through the ringer yet, but I have worn them on half dozen occasions on cold leisure walks and so far they have met/exceeded expectations.
review.name: Most comfortable glove I have every worn

review.reviewBody:
On the first pair I received from Backcountry, two of the fingers on the right glove had about 5/8” extra material than the left glove/all other fingers. They quickly processed a replacement for me. However, the second pair arrived and is a very different color/leather texture/consistency (fingers are all the same length, at least!).  

I realize quality leather products generally have inconsistencies from item to item, but the difference here is pretty stark, as the first pair was quite smooth and the second is very wrinkly. 

Curious if this is a known Hestra issue, if Backcountry has a “bad batch”, or what. I have been waiting to hear back after calling them again, guess we’ll see!
review.name: Vast inconsistencies

review.reviewBody: I already had a pair of lobster-style leather glove/mittens from Hestra (Fall Line) that I've used for skiing the past couple seasons and love them, but I wanted something I could wear day-to-day away from the slopes. The Wakayama are just as warm and durable as my other pair of Hestra gloves but come in a form factor that's a little more casual. If you want the best gloves, Hestra is the way to go.
review.name: Hestra gloves really are the best

name: Wakayama Glove

review.name: Not for every body shape

review.reviewBody: I already have a Barbour vest that is lined and works well in cold weather. This vest is unlined so works better for the milder weather.

review.reviewBody:
I've had a couple of Kebs but these are my favorites. I've had them out during PNW downpours and they shed water really well and I like the fit.
I have 1620 single and double front, Mtn Khaki, Kuhl and Arborwear pants. I spend a lot of days out in all conditions. These are my go-to pants unless it's properly cold out. They're lighter than any of the cotton canvas pants and less restrictive. I also like that the  thigh pockets all have snap closures so that what's in your pockets stays in your pockets.
The new sizing scheme is cut a little smaller, so if you know what size you wear in Fjallravens, size up one. 50 was perfect for me before and 52 fits the same as the 50 did.
review.name: Vidda Pro Pants - Sz 52

review.reviewBody: Bought these in Bozeman MT store. I’m a UPS driver and they just saw their first rain. Love the pants and fit and style, but not really water resistant like I thought they would be. Kinda disappointed for that.
review.name: Great but not good in the rain.

review.reviewBody: Fit great until you start moving, or doing any activity other than standing, with empty pockets. I've never had a pair of pants that make you feel exactly what's in your pockets so strongly..so many cargo areas but I don't even like putting my thin smart phone in the cargo pockets since it restricts movement. I've never had this with another pair in of paints, so even if they fit great in the changing room, make sure you load the pockets with stuff and try some bigger movements before you commit and regret like me.
review.name: Tight pockets

review.reviewBody: I have wanted a pair of Vidda Pros for a while and finally took the plunge. I am a 34" waist in my Carhartt cargos so I ordered a 34. They arrived a week later and were way too small so I returned them and found a shop which had some Greenland jeans which were a perfect fit in a 36 so I bought them and ordered a pair of Viddas in 36. Another week passes, they arrive and again, too small! The legs were snug but fitted well but the waist was about an inch short. I sent them back and ordered a 38. Another week later they arrive, generous but ok in the waist but the legs creased in odd places and the knee shape stuck out and looked really odd. I figured they might be better after a wash but they didn't change. So now I will have to sell them as used, I still don't have any Fjallraven work trousers and I'm really confused about the sizing. I get the impression that they would fit an athletic body shape very well and be a great trouser for years. However, any other body shape and the "fit" doesn't really fit.
review.name: Confusing sizing

review.reviewBody: Well engineered lightweight trousers, but disappointing fit. The cut seems odd. I ordered the exact same size as my Sormland winter trousers, which are a bit loose on me, but the Vidda are uncomfortably tight at the top and around my thighs.
review.name: Good, but have size/cut issues

review.reviewBody: I own several pairs of this pant. The material is rain resistant (may need to wax periodically), with nice fit and finish.  Great for hiking in cool, wet weather, and the Pro version is also good in warm weather with the side zips to dump heat.   Highly recommended.
review.name: Great outdoor pants

review.reviewBody: i bought these at the start of the summer and wore them on a 45 day canoeing trip in northern Nunavut and i only took them off to sleep i got recommended these from a leader i had the previous year who wore them on our 30 day canoeing trip in northern Saskatchewan and said he couldn’t get enough of them they are amazing i loved every feature about them and the only thing that wore was the water proofing all i have to do is re wax them and they’ll be good as new again i extremely recommend these trekking pants
review.name: durable

review.reviewBody: I bought this pair of pants about a month ago and used it for hiking about 3-4 times. Its excellent in terms of its durability. Really like the accesible pockets. The newer fit is better!
review.name: Great Fit and Features

review.reviewBody: The quality of these trousers is immediately apparent when you first put them on. Stitching, hardware, pockets, and all the little details feel very well made and constructed. That being said, I would highly recommend you size up in the waist. The G-1000 material on these trousers is not meant to stretch, so the 44 (29") fits very tight around the waist and thighs. For reference, I am 5'6" / 140-150lbs and usually wear size 29/30 pants. A 46 (30") offers more room but definitely feels a little large. If you're going to order these online make sure you're prepared to make a return or exchange - can't stress enough how odd the sizing is.
review.name: Impressive quality but odd fitment

review.reviewBody:
Have a couple of pair of these trousers, been involved with outdoor activities for over 35 years, worn and tried every type of trouser from army surplus to baggies. These are close to the most expensive trousers I've had but must say are the most comfortable, best fitting and practical trousers I can remember owning.
Great trousers
review.name: Well designed, worth the extra

review.reviewBody: Bought 6 years ago and still in excellent shape- looks good, performs better.
review.name: 6 years and hoping 6 more

review.reviewBody: I was in search of the perfect jacket for 30 - 50 degrees and I think I found it. It is so warm, yet so lightweight; it's perfect for the shoulder months. I have yet to test it under a hard shell, but guessing it will work out great.
review.name: The perfect jacket for 30 - 50 degrees

review.reviewBody: The perfect insulted layer to take on long hikes or multipitch climbs in any season; my go-to when I need wind-stopping insulation, but have no weight or room to spare. I love the fact that I can pack it into it's own pocket (tiny!), clip it to my harness, climb a pitch in my base-layer, then deploy it and put it on to stay nice and warm at the belay. It's warm and weighs next to nothing. Don't leave the car without one!
review.name: Super warm and weighs next to nothing

review.reviewBody: Not as warm as expected for everyday use (I.e. waking around town, waiting for my car to heat up in the AM).  Even in 30-35F days I don’t find this jacket to be all that warm unless I’m relatively active or wearing a HEAVY mid layer. Realizing that this was designed to be as light weight as possible, I can appreciate the sleek unbulky feel though. It looks and feels really good. When wearing while doing something pretty active in the high teens or warmer it’s fine.  If you need to pack it, the low weight and small pack size is great. Wish MH had a jacket of this quality with slightly more insulation but it looks like the next step up is a full blown parka. Bought this to replace an old tattered TNF Morph jacket which was similarly priced with 800 fill down but still find myself grabbing for it over the Ghost Whisperer if it’s in the 20’sF.  A bit overpriced for how much insulation is in it imo but a decent buy if you plan to primarily use for highly active situations or plan to wear heavy layers underneath.
review.name: Great jacket under particular circumstances

review.reviewBody: I got this for my boyfriend for his birthday. He did a lot of research on what down jacket he wanted and landed on this one. It is extremely lightweight but he says it keeps him plenty warm. It fits snug enough to wear under a shell. He has a Mountain Hardware shell that fits over it perfectly. When we got the jacket in the mail there were a few places where we found loose threads. We cut those off and I don’t believe he’s found anymore. He had to let it sit out for a few days to fluff up a bit after it was in the shipping box.
review.name: Lightweight and Warm

review.reviewBody: For those complaining about durability: this jacket is 8oz! it's not intended to be hucked thru the trees, that's what puffers with heavy ripstop fabric are for, they generally weigh 20-3x more than this jacket. Ive worn this jacket on long, freezing cold photoshoots in the ice and snow; ive worn it boating down freezing rivers at 20 degrees. The jacket is easy to mend with a little aquaseal, it takes less than one minute (not mtn. hardware recommended i doubt but it works for mine).  There isnt a jacket made that's equals this items warmth to weight ratio. The fact you can wear a t-shirt in 20 degree weather and stay warm and dry speaks to the quality. I own both the OG ghost whisperer and the Ghost 2 w/hood. This is the first product ive written a review about, it's that good. Mtn hardware.  warranty is awesome. my OG jacket needed a new zipper- mtn hardware had it back to me in a week or two, no charge. Buy it.
review.name: Best Jacket Ive Ever Owned

review.reviewBody: I own two.  Hooded and non-hooded.  I keep one neatly in my closet and one in my truck.
review.name: G.O.A.T.

review.reviewBody: I'm very impressed with this jacket so far. It's extremely light and packable, yet very warm considering how small it is. The hood fits snugly around hats as well. The durability is still to be tested, as I've mainly worn it out and about in town, but so far it's a great jacket!
review.name: Great puffy jacket!

review.reviewBody:
For starters I live in Montana, it's cold. Like really cold. This jacket rips, I'll wear it 20 degree weather with nothing but a t-shirt under it. Currently -5 here, I'm wearing it with a hoodie under it never been warmer. I ski in this thing nonstop, I have a shell on the outer layer and that's it. I've skied it in 30 degree weather, in -10 degree weather, no matter this bad boy keeps heat in and cold out. Plus this is the lightest jacket imaginable, it folds down into a tiny little pocket which makes it brilliant for camping/hiking. It looks sharp and is my go to jacket everyday here. 

It's warm, looks great, and regulates heat perfectly. My only complaint is the torso length, it's about 1-2 inches shorter than I would like it to be, but it's still long enough to be tucked into my ski pants. I am 6'3 about 185 and the arms are the perfect length and i have no issues layering underneath or on top of this. I usually only need one layer underneath this if it's frigid out, I can't really see a situation where I would need more than one midlayer. 

I can't recommend this jacket enough, if you're gonna buy a higher end down jacket this is the one. Price tag is worth it, you'll never buy another jacket.
review.name: Last Jacket I'll ever buy!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as an outer layer and as a mid layer.  So far very pleased with it as an outer layer with a base layer and light mid layer.  Have used it on numerous small hikes in temps in low thirties.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: I purchased Scarpa Vapor climbing shoes for the first time recently. I was initially very impressed with the shoes. They were comfortable out of the box and performed exceptionally. However, I only used them a handful of times and they already have a hole in the toe through the leather. Generally, I have been able to get several months of use from my climbing shoes and am able to resole them a few times before the wear is too damaged. It seems that the Vapor has a design flaw in that the toe rand comes to a narrow point with a small gap in the rubber where the leather is exposed. I contacted Scarpa warranty directly but they did not stand behind their product. Very disappointing.
review.name: Vapor Lace design Flaw

name: Vapor Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Loved the fit/look. felt great and has very good grip. 

I read previous reviews and saw complaints about the heel getting worn out fast (as in a month) . Well here is a picture after wearing the shoe 3 times! 3!!! 

now the length I wore then was all about an hour. Just noticed this after an hour at a dog park. Nothing strenuous what so ever. Got these as a B day present 29th of September and it's now Oct 5th.

Very disappointed to say the least 😕
review.name: Shoe is a Bust

review.reviewBody: These shoes are very comfortable, mostly due to the insole. If they had just a tad more cushioning underneath, they'd be perfect. Fits true to size for me.
review.name: Awesome shoe

review.reviewBody: Ordered my usual size but it was too large and then got a half size smaller. After wearing them out for the first time, I noticed on some of the smoother rocks traction was lost slightly and the tread just didn't grab like I expected. The overall platform is comfortable but the application for an approach shoe misses the mark and it is more suitable for stairs.
review.name: Larger than expected and tread is slippy

review.reviewBody: Nice daily driver but the plastic framing inside the heel cut broke within 6 months, now digs into my ankle. Disappointed.
review.name: Quality issues

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pair of Oboz and these are by far the most comfortable every day shoes.  My only issue is the lining in the heel wore out after one year but thankfully, Backcountry exchanged them for a new pair.  I'm hoping I don't have the same issue with this pair as I really like the fit and comfort of these shoes - no break-in necessary.....  I found these to be true to size despite others saying they run large - I would give them 5 stars but due to my original issue, I'm going with 4.
review.name: Comfort+

review.reviewBody: I've had the shoes for three months and every wear my feet and body feel worse.  I have high arches, so maybe it's my fault.  The laces come across the top of my foot restricting the blood flow to my feet, so my toes tingle.  I recently went on a 2.5 mile hike and my shins are sore, which is something I've never felt even when backpacking 10 miles or more in other shoes.  My arches in my feet are equally sore which only happens in these shoes.  Also, I can see the fabric inside the shoe is already wearing out from my heel.  I read a previous review of someone with a similar experience but he was walking 4 or 5 miles a day, which I am not.
review.name: Most uncomfortable shoe I own
comment:
Hi Aaron!

I'm so sorry to hear about your experience with these. I also have high arches, and currently the similar options I have tried from Lowa, Hoka, Salomon and Keen have all been winners!!  Feel free to reach out to a Gearhead to talk about exchanging your shoes, we'd be happy to help make sure you get in the right pair!!
Donate them to the nearest Homeless Shelter...

review.reviewBody: All around best shoe that does it all!
review.name: All Around Best Shoe!

review.reviewBody:
These are the most comfortable hybrid hiking everyday shoe going. I?ve had a ton of shoes/sneakers and these are the tops. Also great looking to boot! 
 I normally wear a 12 but due to the bigger toe box I purchased a 11.5. Glad I did!
review.name: Unreal Comfort!
comment: I was under the impression these only come in 11 and 12, no 11.5...

name: Bozeman Low Leather Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft
hasVariant.description: Buy the Carlisle Paddles Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft
review.reviewBody: Ordered this paddle on Backcountry to receive a caved in box with a dented paddle and no packaging material inside. Asked for a replacement they send me out ... a new dented paddle with no packaging material inside. So now I have a damaged product and it costs $8 each time to watch them make the same mistake.  Cool stuff
review.name: Reliably damaged on delivery

review.itemreviewed: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft
review.reviewBody: Too heavy, blades have unfinished look (plastic shavings hanging on edges, blades have no channels - splashing water, clunky at the joint.
review.name: Unhappy paddler

review.itemreviewed: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft
review.reviewBody: That it is a good product - I have this brand canoe and kayak paddles - prefer this brand - been very dependable - I have no complaints
review.name: Recent purchase of kayak paddle

review.itemreviewed: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft
review.reviewBody: I never knew there was such a difference with paddles, until I got my Magic Mystic paddles. What a difference from my old paddles. I had to get another pair for our other kayak. Couldn't be happier.
review.name: I never knew

review.itemreviewed: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft
review.reviewBody: I had another Carlisle paddle before I bought this one and I was pleased with it so after it was stolen I decided to get another. My other one didn't have an aluminum shaft and I'm not crazy over the aluminum. It arrived dented and feel very thin so I'm sure it will get dented even more. It doesn't effect the usability but I was still bummed to received a damaged product. I have a sit on top kayak that I use for slow moving rivers and lakes and the paddle works well.
review.name: ok paddle
comment: Thanks for your review! The "dents" in the shaft are actually intentional by the vendor. The two "dents" are in the right hand shaft only which happened when Carlisle pressed the aluminum shaft to give that section an oval shape so you can hold the paddle at the correct angle when paddling.

name: Magic Mystic Aluminum Paddle - Straight Shaft

review.reviewBody: Love these cargo pants for work. Can also be dressed up. I’m 5’5” and they ran a little long on me, but otherwise the fit is TTS. Fabric is perfect weight for all year around wear (in CA). Would make great travel pants!

review.reviewBody: These pants are super cute, but even the small was very big for me. I returned it for an extra small and I never buy that size these pants run large.
review.name: Very WIDE leg

review.reviewBody: Ordered the XS. Too long and definitely have to use the drawstring to keep them up. I’m 5’3 135lbs.
review.name: Cargo pants

review.reviewBody: I’m usually between a small and a medium in pants so I tried both, and the small was perfect. I love these so much! So comfortable and flattering. Very versatile too, from athletic to office. Sometimes I think they look like scrubs which I have mixed feelings about, but I love the cargo pockets and the overall look.
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: So soft and stylish. Great for dressing up or dressing down. Great fit as well. Not to long for my height (5'5").
review.name: Great Pants

review.reviewBody: Great pants, look good on and well made. Excellent for travel. Have 4 of these pants I'm always ready to go out the door.
review.name: Great pants, look good on

I love them but they are way too long
I’m going to try and hem them.
review.name: Wide Leg Cargo pants

review.reviewBody: Cute style, great fabric but run WAY BIG! About 2 sizes easily. Returning cuz go smallest size - and I am not that small!!!! Drop down 2 sizes for sure.
review.name: Cute style, great fabric but

review.reviewBody: Love them! Wear them for work. Performance material perfect for this summer weather. Runs a bit big though. And I tried them on before purchase.
review.name: Love them! Wear them for

Perfect for traveling, running errands and the material is soft and practical!
Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Had the previous model and wore it in the gym, multipitch trad, and everything in between. Was comfortable for a big 20-pitch day. Decently comfortable for a hanging belay, too. Adjustment straps work well. Padding is comfy. When I wore out the previous model, I bought this one and don’t notice any discernible changes besides the color (which frankly I don’t love, but I love everything else about this harness so I’ll grin and bear the weird violet/mauve…). Only giving 4 instead of 5 stars because the color is truly disappointing to me.
review.name: Comfortable and reliable

review.reviewBody: As a plus size skier, it is hard to find pants that not only fit, but also keep me warm and dry. These pants exceeded my expectations. They kept me looking amazing with my Snowcrew Anarak coat! These pants stretch so carving and getting on and off a lift were not an issue. The adjustable sides, keep pants on and snug. The pockets are great and kept my phone dry. Way to go! I am hooked and will wear this brand from now on.
review.name: Wonderful Pants - for all sizes I would buy again!

review.reviewBody: Nice quality. The waist was good but the legs were very large. Very baggy on me so I returned them. I like OR products but it bugs me that I have to pay to ship back my return.
review.name: Legs too big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these pants for a trip to Iceland. They are the perfect mix of warmth and lightweight. Even able to pack them in a stuff sack. The waist cinch is def one of the best I've seen. I typically would be a 3x, except when I tried them on it hurt to sit down. No give. They would have been perfect for skiing and being upright. So I went with the 4x because I had largely purchase for a buggy tour where I would be sitting down for multiple hours. They are way too big in the waist though. And too long for me, I'm 5'5". I keep stepping on the bottom part. Otherwise quality is fantastic.
review.name: Great for warmth and packing, issues with sitting & length

review.reviewBody: I wear these snow pants all the time. They are not super heavy or bulky but they are warm enough for nights it has been -30 degrees Celsius(wear a wool base layer with them though for cold nights) and colder for northern lights photos and going for walks outside. Highly recommend these pants. I wear a 4x and they are great.
review.name: Very warm and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: The picture of this does not do justice. Colors are vibrant. great fit, verry glad I bought this
review.name: love!!!

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: Recipient kept saying "I can't believe how soft this is.  I'm going to live in this!"
review.name: A winning gift!!

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I’ve always called these Patagonia’s “ugly fleeces” - they’re not ugly, of course, but have the wackiest patterns. In any case, I’ve been waiting for the right “ugly fleece” for me and was so excited to order this one!

When it arrived I thought the colors looked a little more fluorescent than they photographed online and I was thinking I’d probably return it, but ended up loving it when I put it on. The fit is great, I ordered a medium because I wanted a bit looser of a fit. It’s perfect. Another winner.
review.name: Worth the wait!

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my trip to Alaska and upcoming trip to Iceland. It kept me warm in the chilly days and fits well! I am usually a medium, but I sized down to a small. It fit well without feeling snug, perfect for what I needed. I’m sure a medium would have had an oversized feel.
review.name: Warm, cute, and cozy!

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the comfiest, coziest pull over sweater I’ve ever owned! Not to mention how cool the print is, I get compliments every time I wear it!
review.name: My favorite sweater!

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, sleeves are nice and long (which is always an issue if you are tall, but this one totally passes the test!) and the bright blue with green trim is such a fun, almost 90’s retro style that will be so cute for spring to throw on with running shorts. I’m usually between a size small and medium, and went with small on this and love the fit. I only wear a tank or just a bra underneath, so it fits super well without being too tight or baggy.
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm sad to have to return this because the colors are great, the fleece weight is perfect, and I got it on sale. The sleeve cuffs are massive and fall well below my hands. I would have to roll the sleeves up like a toddler, even though the rest of it fits me well. I don't think sizing down would work for me. Possibly a defect? I tried on a similar style fleece that I have from another company, and the cuffs on that one fit extremely well and are a full two inches narrower.
review.name: Sleeve cuffs are huge

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: This fleece fits well and is a good outer layer. The fit is roomy enough for me to fit layers underneath, if needed. Material is soft and seems like it will wear well. Would definitely buy again.
review.name: Great fleece

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve never written a review here before but I got two of these sweaters today and really love them. I’ve gotten Patagonia synchilla before and didn’t love them. The material on these are much more flexible and comfortable. I got the rust color and grey with navy in size medium. Rust goes perfect with my Uggs! I probably could’ve gone with small but I like my clothes a little more breathable. I am 5’6” 130lbs for reference. Really excited to wear these on my trip to Quebec.
review.name: Surprised how much I love it

review.itemreviewed: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love how it fits perfectly! So comfy and nice for fall.
review.name: Sooo warm and soft

name: Synchilla Lightweight Snap-T Fleece Pullover - Women's

description: Buy the Patagonia Performance Twill Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Performance Twill Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Performance Twill Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The material feels ok, but the cut is very restrictive with little to no stretch. They also run very small (I’m a 28, and ordered a 28 -but should’ve ordered 30 in these). I originally ordered these as I needed a pair of pants that could double as hiking pants to visit some national parks while on vacation. I would not recommend these for that.
review.name: They run small

review.reviewBody: Great pant: comfortable, fits well and has style.
review.name: Best Pant Ever

review.reviewBody:
Some reviews say they run small, I ordered my usual size and they were too big. Short size was no where near a 30? inseam. Leg opening very big. 

Great material, wanted to love these but couldn?t get the right fit. If you get a pair that fits, you scored.
review.name: Fit was way off

review.reviewBody:
I was excited to get these. I like Patagonia, and the material & construction are indeed nice!

But, they run smaller than what I?m used to. I am about a 34" or 35" in Uniqlo, Gap, or Levi pants (though after months of quarantine and not enough exercise, 35" is probably more true). I am an average build for a desk worker, 5'10" & 180 lbs, perhaps with slightly wider-than-average hips. I bike a few times a week, but I am no super-fit runner or climber.

I ordered 34"/Short, figuring these have some stretch. The pants say this is a 30" inseam, which seems about right for me, matching my expectations & my height. Unfortunately, when I tried them on, I realized that I would need either a 36" or 37" size.

I?ve just measured my waistline with a string & yardstick (obviously should have done this before ordering), and it is about 37.25" ? so I suppose maybe Gap & Uniqlo have flattering sizing, while Patagonia is probably more scientifically accurate.

Also notable: the cut of these is not really "slim fit" in the sense I am used to. The thigh area seems pretty tight, while the lower legs are pretty loose. I prefer a more tapered cut for comfort, biking, & aesthetics.

So, I guess maybe I?ll try again, but perhaps with a different pair of Patagonias at a larger size.
review.name: Seems nice, but runs small

hasVariant.name: Mad House 8 Tent: 8-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Mad House 8 Tent: 8-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used as a family (of 8) camping tent. Easy set up and break down. Tons of storage pouches.  On first use this tent completely stood up to a 2 hour torrential down pore. All the rain water from 2 roads drained into our site; within 15 minutes the tent was sitting in 2-3 inches of water, after 30 min there was 6 inches.  Even with all of our gear, high winds, thunder and lighting all around there were ZERO leaks with the rainfly in place.  Highly recommend this tent.  Highest quality and great price for a 4 season tent!
review.name: 6 ⭐️ ‘s. Withstands the worst weather!!!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted to get another pair of the “Holly Pants”, which I love and have had for many years, however Marmot has discontinued them. The “Arche Rock Pants”, according to a very helpful person in Consumer Service, are the closest match. 
I like the pants but I’d prefer a light soft lining which the Holly pants have and a softer outside material which probably is less water resistant. The Arche Rock pants have a thin material with no lining and they rustle when I walk. Maybe some of the stiffness will decrease over time.
The navy color and the fit are fine but the length a bit short I’m 5’6” 135lbs and size 8.
review.name: Nice but not exactly what Im looking for.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, stretch and comfort for everyday wear.
review.name: Perfect pants

description: Buy the BioLite FirePit Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FirePit Griddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the BioLite FirePit Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am very disappointed that when I removed the label/sticker from my new griddle a large patch of adhesive/sticker was left stuck to the griddle. The pre-seasoned griddle had to be washed with soap before its first use, and even then ive had to resort to trying to bake off the adhesive. For the price of this griddle I would have thought BioLite would have used a less destructive adhesive for its label on cast iron.
review.name: Not a good start
comment: Thanks for sharing. We’ll pass this along to our manufacturing team. This is quite a unique situation since the sticker is designed for easy removal. We hope you get to enjoy your griddle.

review.reviewBody: It's a good size. I'm still getting to know it and how to get the most out of it while I'm cooking. I'm using it at home in the oven instead of with a biolite stove. So far so good.
review.name: Great size

review.reviewBody: works well! nice addition! got it on sale! fits just right
review.name: griddle for campfire

review.reviewBody: This makes your fire pit the only thing you need to bring
review.name: Here’s the griddle you need

review.reviewBody: Have only used it once but seems to be of good quality and I like the design.  It comes with a bag however I wish there was a way to store or attach it to my FirePit bag.
review.name: Good design and quality

review.reviewBody: Absolute game changer!  When camping, I first used it over top of my two burner Coleman stove and it was awesome - did pancakes and bacon at the same time.  Then I lit charcoal in the Firepit and did wings, burgers and flatbread pizza in the cast iron griddle. So good!
review.name: Game changing addition to Firepit

review.reviewBody: Wow this is cool. You have a griddle that works great. This is a must if you have the firepit. It just makes it good for everything.
review.name: Get This

review.reviewBody: Tools all have a good feel in the hand. I wish they were shorted and more lightweight overall, but at this price point it's a no brainer if you don't have spare grill tools to use when out camping.
review.name: Nice camp tools, but certainly not lightweight

review.reviewBody: Sturdy griddle. Good for the price. Agree with other reviews that surface was too rough. Grinded it down and reseasoned it. Used it on the girl it, on the grill, and even inside. Working much better now and will last for years to come.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely awesome and versatile. We cooked a 3 course breakfast for a family of four on it with ease. Love it!
review.name: Great for cooking big meals!

name: FirePit Griddle

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable with great traction, I wish these atlas clog came in different colors
review.name: I wish these atlas clog came in different colors

review.reviewBody: This clog is pretty comfortable and the traction is terrific. I've worn these while running errands and my feet didn't get tired and didn't hurt. And they look good too!
review.name: All-Terrain Atlas Clog

review.reviewBody: I only wear these camping or on vacation, they wore out on the bottom in a couple of months they are now slippery and I don't wear them anymore. Too much money for not even lasting a year.
review.name: They're cool but...

review.reviewBody: Great in many ways, but they don't lock your foot in enough to be a technical shoe. The heel strap needs to be more adjustable and there needs to be an extra strap to tighten the top of the foot to the insole. with this, they would be perfect for hiking on technical terrain. Needs fun colors!
review.name: I really wanted to like these

review.reviewBody: Purchased as a gift. The recipient is in Love with these shoes. They are so comfortable they don't know how they'll go back to wearing regular shoes.
review.name: Won't be able to ever go back to regular shoes

review.reviewBody: Heat traction headed to the sauna, can't wait to try them in sport mode crossing rivers
review.name: Sturdy for their purpose

review.reviewBody: Not all that comfy for me. Rubs in spots and I don't like wearing them very much.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: Love the rugged design of these. They are very wide so if you have wide feet, these are for you. They are swimming on me!
review.name: Rugged Design

review.reviewBody: I'm leaving a 1 bc these were 2 sizes smaller as well but they were smaller and don't fit the back of my foot well or entirely I should returned them

review.reviewBody: The old Backcountry Covert liners were my absolute favorite and I was so sad when they stopped making them. Well these take those liners to a whole new level of comfort! These liners are simple, yet just right and honestly that's exactly what I want in my MTB liners. The legs don't ride up and also don't cut into my legs, the chamois is comfy, and the fabric is super nice. If they had cargo pockets, they would quickly become my go-to for every ride.

description: Buy the ZOIC Carbon Bib Liner - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carbon Bib Liner - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the ZOIC Carbon Bib Liner - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Zoic is a mountain bike company. Period. These bib liners are made to suit that purpose. I could see them being used by XC Riders, and specifically long all day trail riding...which leads to how I found them. I have been gearing up for some long bike packing routes and races and needed something that could handle days of riding, a loaded bike, and not bunch and bind like every other liner, bib, chamois, I have ever used does. These are perfect. Almost like they aren't there at all, except pain on my sit bones doesn't exist. These are so good, I ordered a second one. After spending 6+ hours on one ride in the saddle, with zero issues, I don't even want to try another bib liner for all day riding and touring.
review.name: Excellent when used for what they are.

review.reviewBody:
These are the worst bibs or shorts I have ever tried. The chamois is misplaced by inches. It is way too far forward. This really screws up the fit. When sitting up you?re right on the seam and I can?t possibly imagine the aero position one would need to be in use the front portion. It feels like a piece of ham in your shorts.
Fabric choice could be more breathable for a liner and the ?convenient flap? could be designed to better ?maintain containment?, or dare I say, omitted all together.
review.name: Unquestionably the worst.

name: Carbon Bib Liner - Men's

review.reviewBody: Made of heavyweight fleece material and designed for layering. I love the feel of the fabric and its well made. The fit is a little boxy and sleeves a bit on the long side but this is a minor issue for the price and otherwise has the euro fit you want. Looks stylish and classy when zipped up and dries quickly if you get a bit sweaty as the day warms up. This is an insulation layer: Not windproof or waterproof so careful pairing with baselayer or vest is required. Bought it in the grey, size medium.
review.name: Warm training top for cold days

review.reviewBody: I have a relatively small and slim build (5'9", 140lbs) and size medium was too small.  Bummer since the shirt did look quite cool.  By the way, it is definitely warm/thermal, as advertised.
review.name: Had to return, to small

review.reviewBody: Size L is right for me: 6’2” 165 lbs. Feels good. Looks good.
review.name: Looks good. Fit is good.

review.reviewBody: I ride a lot during the winter and I have four of these jerseys to keep me warm.  If it's in the 40s I typically have a base layer under the jersey and then subtract it as the day warms.  Solid product.  I'm 5'10" and 155 and the jersey fits perfectly.
review.name: Great winter jersey

review.reviewBody: This jersey is well made and fits perfectly.  The material is soft and stays soft after multiple washings.  It works great on our cold(ish) winter days in Northern California but not so bulky that you feel that you're padded for shipping.  Great work!
review.name: Perfect For Cool Weather Days

review.reviewBody: I used it on a road ride with the temperature In the mid 40’s and a breeze of 10 mph from the North under sunny conditions. I wore a thin, short sleeved base + thin, long sleeved base. I didn’t feel restricted/constricted regarding movement. Initially, the ride was much uphill. Only briefly did I feel too warm. For the descent, I was comfortable. Probably, could have gotten by with  1 (better, thicker) base layer.  I would agree with other reviews stating that the sleeves are a little long, but I just rolled them over my gloves and that was a good enough.  Because of the breezy conditions, I always prefer the form fit from Castelli which a M shirt sleeve delivers,  but not so much this one. Overall, a good cold weather option that I would recommend.  For a sizing comparison, I also purchased a similar M - size Gore product,  but it was a little too big.
review.name: Warm Winter jacket

review.reviewBody: I'm 5' 10", 160 lbs and the large fits me perfectly. Trim, but not skin tight. The material has good stretch, but not excessive. The weight is spot on as well. I wore it this morning over a layer at 48° F. I could have gone with a lighter base layer. The design is nicer than I thought. The black bars actually have micro perforations in them, giving the jersey a more sophisticated look.
review.name: Perfect cool weather jersey

review.reviewBody:
I've worn this jersey down to 33°F with a long-sleeved base layer, and a light jacket. It is very warm, wicks well, and feels nice on a long ride. The sleeves are little long, but that's good for pulling over gloves. If I must be picky, the collar does tend to roll flat if partially unzipped. On my last ride temps were 33-54°, it never felt hot, damp, or stuffy. I would buy a 2nd.
 The full width chest reflective strip is nice for early starts. My Castelli bib tights have reflective cuffs and combined give great front/back visibility.
review.name: Warm & Cozy

review.reviewBody: I loved this thing out of the box, the looks (mine was black) and fleece lining are really nice. However, the fit was a bit bulky for my skinny  and short frame at 5'5" and 120 lbs compared to all the other Castelli jerseys I've had and long as well, really long so much so that multiple rolls were required to keep it from hitting below my crotch area and butt. I guess this helps accommodate base layers underneath but it was excessive for me and I returned it. I would have guessed this was a medium with a "classic" or "fondo" relaxed cut, not the usual trim and race ready Castelli form.
review.name: Great design and style, just a bit bulky

review.reviewBody: Fits as advertised. Good quality.
review.name: Great jacket

name: Puro 3 Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Great all around jacket for cold days, still or active, city to backcountry. It has a lot to offer in this mere 10oz and quite packable piece. With ease of movement the jacket’s integrated elastic cords grapple your waist and will hold on to your wrists so you won’t have to worry about the jackets riding up your arm or chest while in heavy activity. The wind proofing is substantial while surprisingly rain will wet out the face fabric…however the moreno Swiss wool stayed warm when wet and did not take long to dry out. 

Fun fact; This swisswool jacket out of Romania is covered by the Ortovox Wool Promise. Expect excellent, odor repellent, moisture management for such a great warmth to weight ratio of 90 g/m2 (chest and back); 60g/m2 (sleeves and sides) AND rest assured these European sheep are being carefully sought after with excellent Tasmanian farmers.
review.name: Articulated but no DWR

name: Swisswool Piz Segnas Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Poor quality! The black metal piece holding the strap in broke (twice) on my right shoe (as shown in my pictures). I had tried super gluing the first time since the piece hadn't broke all the way off, but the second time, the piece snapped completely off. They were super comfy shoes and I loved wearing them but can't wear now since the strap isn't able to stay on. The left shoe is still 100% perfect.
review.name: Poor quality
comment: Hello Beth, We’re sorry the black metal piece holding the strap in broke. Please contact our Customer Care team at (888) My-Sorel or web chat so we can make this right.

review.reviewBody: These are very cute and comfortable! I hope these hold up well! I do plan on spraying them with something to make them more weather resistant. Definitely size up a half size. I am usually a size 9 and the 9.5 fits perfects for clogs! I have only worn them 2 times so far. I wore them for 8 hours and did lots of walking and didn’t have any foot pain or blisters.
review.name: Very comfortable and cute

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a womens 7 in all my other Sorel boots/shoes but these run extremely small. I wish I would have tried them on in person to see if the 7.5 would have been OK or if I really should have went up a full size. Probably a full size if you want to wear them with socks. I do they they are really cute and I get compliments on them often.
review.name: Cute but run small!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for casual days in or out of the home. Great for airport travel! TTS. I prefer mine with scrunchy socks.
review.name: The most comfortable!

review.reviewBody: The size of these do not match other sorel sizes. You should consider sizing up a full size and not just half a size. I normally wear a 9.5 in all my other sorels, but these apparently I would be a10.5. I’m fine with trying out different sizes, but to me, it is super frustrating that you have to continue to pay for shipping if their sizing is inconsistent.
review.name: Small
comment: Hello KM, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our VIIBE™ Women's Clog is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
DON'T BUY THEM. They are not made to last. Metal pin came out. 
I used them 20 times but it was a little bit more than a year, and they didn't want to take care of them, knowing they got so many reviews because of that. 
They don't worth the money.
review.name: DON"T BUY THEM
comment: Hello Dolores, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: Love the style and color. Really nice to wear to work or to the store.
review.name: Nice comfort shoe.

review.reviewBody: Super cute and comfy. True to size. I wish I had bought the black ones too.
review.name: Buy them. You won’t regret it.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these clogs they are so comfortable. I have horrible diabetic neuropathy on the tops of my feet and can rarely wear shoes for more then a couple hours before I have to go in stocking feet. These are amazing I can wear them and entire 9 hour shift at work.
review.name: Foottastic

review.reviewBody: What a great pair of shoes. Comfortable, & wide enough for my fate feet!
review.name: Comfortable & Neutral

name: VIIbe Clog - Women's

hasVariant.name: DC Hardwire Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Dometic DC Hardwire Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Cable too short.  Have to splice an extra 3-4 feet to reach above the passenger side cubby on the Tacoma DCLB.  Clean appearance, good quality enclosure.  Screw plug makes it worth it.
review.name: Provided cable too short for Tacoma DCLB

review.reviewBody: Well designed, easy to set up, very durable, very happy!
review.name: Well designed, easy to set up, very durable

review.reviewBody:
I almost didn't pick this up because its not hard to wire up an appropriate wire run from the battery to a power port.  However, the thing I love about this is that the Dometic DC plug for the coolers can twist lock into this device so it can't pop out on the road.  Which is worth every penny.

So I ordered it for that reason, but I have to say, this kits is excellent.  The wire that comes with it is super high quality heavy gauge and completely (loomed) or covered to protect itself, it made install the power to our built in cooler in our Jeep Wrangler TJ twice as easy as it would have been.   Plus i get the extra power port at the back of the vehicle which is handy.

Worth it for the twist lock connection!  Worth it for the excellent and very long heavy gauge wiring harness!
review.name: Seems silly but Worth it!

name: DC Hardwire Kit

review.itemreviewed: x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I thought these were going to be the last wading boots I needed to buy, EVER. Turns out the boots stretched at least a size and a half after using them for 3/4 days, and now they are way too big. I found them to be extraordinarily heavy as well, compared to what one might assume by looking at the pictures. I was not impressed with lack of support and the lack of feeling stable in the boot, but as I mentioned, the boots stretched terribly after using them for 4 days.
review.name: ZERO value

review.itemreviewed: x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I now own 3 pairs of these awesome boots! I got a pair for myself a couple years ago, then got a pair for my daughter and girlfriend. I have put my boots in salt water 3-5 times a week for a couple years now and they get better every time I don them. If you wear a size 11 no need to size up for your washers they are already spec to fit over booties.
review.name: Best boot ever

review.itemreviewed: x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Totally love the aesthetics of this boot but I would avoid purchasing them if I were you. As others have said, they are super flat footed and clunky. Every-time I wear these, I trip in the water, can't feel anything. These are pretty cinderblocks.
review.name: Super Clunky

review.itemreviewed: x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good Support? They DO NOT, the uppers just fall over when they aren't laced up as shown. Also there is no ARCH sopport, its for flat-footed people and those that don't wanna walk very far. It won't even advise what size to buy based upon what kinda wader you are gonna wear. When I saw "Danner" I thought I was getting a BOOT, not a SNEAKER.
review.name: Do these Boots look like they have .....

review.itemreviewed: x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I live in SoCal and the few remaining trout waters here are a serious hike to get into (steep descents/even rappelling into canyons). I like wading boots for wet wading with neoprene socks when I finally make it down the canyon, but have never liked wading boots for the approach and return (generally squishy, heavy and ill-fitting). After my previous Simms boots fell apart I splurged and got these. Man, the Simms/Danner River Salt boots are great. I?ve used them the past two days and seriously felt like I was wearing good hiking boots with ankle support even on the way back up. We?ll see how these last long-term but the initial impression is very positive, looking for the next excuse to wear them. Purchased 10, normally 9.5, fit is tight/solid with neoprene socks. Question, is there a leather conditioner I should use?
review.name: Great for the hike-in

name: x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's
x Danner River Salt Wading Boot - Men's

description: Buy the BioLite BaseCharge 1500+ online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BaseCharge 1500+
hasVariant.description: Buy the BioLite BaseCharge 1500+ online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We bought this during the pandemic for camping along with solar pannels.  Our town was hit by a serious derecho a month ago and we lost power for a week.  The Base Charge 1500 saved us for the first few days.  I was able to make coffee--for my entire neighbor hood--for the first 3 days. I made coffee (grinder and espresso machine) and toast for a week without having to recharge.  We eventually got a generator for our freezer and fridge as the power outage went on for a week, but the Biolite was absolutely the best.  I was more than impressed and. as a coffee afficianado,  it saved my life. I highly recommend this.
review.name: Saved us from a derecho!

review.reviewBody: Perfect unit as advertised. Easy to use and easily portable. Ideal for off grid applications.
review.name: Perfect

name: BaseCharge 1500+

hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Trestles 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great 3 season bag! I purchased this for my son after he insisted on using my Marmot bag and I’m so glad he has his own! The same quality we expected at a great price!
review.name: Great 3 season bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] comfy, perfect weight for my needs(I'm not a backpacker), it compacts nicely, the fabric is quite soft
review.name: Glad I Bought This

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great 3 seasons bag for those warmer nights!  It is light, packs down small, and the synthetic does not bunch up like some down bags.  I run warm, so this bag truly works for me down to 25°-30° F.  The zipper is sturdy and no problems with snags.  Very satisfied, Nice Marmot !
review.name: Perfect 3 Seasons Bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this bag for almost all my adventures in the Rockies. Dream bag really. Soft like down. Packs up small and light. Marmot’s synthetic is absolutely amazing. I use thi bag almost year round!
review.name: Better than down

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is great! Always keeps me warm, I loved the hooded top to keep my head warm when it gets cold. The color and inside design makes me happy. Always recommend !
review.name: My favorite sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased my first down bag in 1989 on a trip to Kittery Trading Post in Maine on a weekend free from graduate school.  My now-husband ordered the mirror-image bag so that we could zip them together to keep me warmer during backpacking trips.  We still have both bags and use them all the time, whether in the backpacking, or as a duvet during car camping.  I've relofted mine twice now, both times with incredible customer service from Marmot.
review.name: Trestle-like bag bought in 1989

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this sleeping bag to go backpacking in Colorado. It more than performed. It is warm and lightweight and packed nicely in my pack. I wound up purchasing the same bag for my son.
review.name: Great sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worked appropriately well in 30 degree weather, no complaints
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag for those chilly nights!  I run hot and have used this down into the 20s (F) with no issues.  Spacious all over including feet and for side sleeping. The zippers are heavy-duty and zip well.  Mummy head for the colder nights and the bag has a pocket placed conveniently.  I also love how compact it gets while stored!
review.name: Cozy and spacious on those chilly nights

review.reviewBody: This bag is very comfortable, perfect for the southwest Colorado bow season. At this price point I don’t know if it can be rivaled. You just can’t go wrong!
review.name: Best bang for the buck!

name: Trestles 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: The shoe was a great fit at for my foot. They were very comfortable compared to some of the other shoes I’ve tried on or used. I love the closer system on them allowing you to tighten a specific area to your needs. The shoe does run big and I made a mistake getting street size. I would definitely recommend down sizing for this shoe.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: After a year and a half going through multiple pairs of Tenaya Oasi LV, I finally jumped on the novelty train with the Indalo. I do love the low volume version of the Oasi but they are ridiculously hard to find in mens sizing despite being marketed as unisex. Having somewhat narrow foot shape in relation to length, I had never found a trusty fit in unlaced shoes until Oasi LV. Luckily, not only is Indalo a step up in construction quality and details, at half a size down (US 9 versus 9.5 in Oasi LV) the newest member of Tenaya is an almost ideal fit! The comfort, too, is right up there, despite feeling a touch more assertive and supportive on edges.  It also breathes better thanks to some nifty mesh paneling under the tongue. Really, they are both stellar shoes and I am flabbergasted that hardly any brick and mortars carry them jn Minnesota. Bigger brands must have the market pretty cornered when even REI only ever stocks thd Mundaka (way, way too wide for guys like me). Hoping for better availability and wider support for the folks at Tenaya.
review.name: Another stellar shoe from Tenaya folks

review.reviewBody: Great sock like shoe, I upgraded from the mastia, and it was a major upgrade. The way this model is able to sinch down makes this shoe feel perfect. Heal is what I prefer not super tight, but tight enough you feel what your doing back there. Plus the extra little rubber on the heel definitely helps stay on those sloped heal hooks.
review.name: They go on my Feet.

name: Indalo Climbing Shoe

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: The material of the short is excellent, however the chamois is only sewn into the short in the front and the back/not the part that contacts the seat. This leads to lots of movement of the chamois and bunching while riding/and consequently will lead to a lot of chaffing. I am sure the mobile chamois has some purpose, but I couldn't find it, and returned the shorts as a result.
review.name: Chamois is not sewn in?

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: More compression than the Mille GT shorts that I bought previously, which have been comfortable and durable.  Chamois is also comfy in these.
review.name: Good biking shorts

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: an uncomfortable ride then buy these overpriced uncomfortable shorts. Like the other review said these shorts have a chamois that’s not  completely sewn in. The sides and the top have no foundation at all, the design is terrible. The chamois bunches up while riding, it’s uncomfortable and irritating. Save your money and don’t buy.
review.name: If you want…..

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: A bit pricy but well worth it. First ride 4 hours and really like it. Quality of the fabric is top. I am 5:10 140lbs and purchase Large good fit.
review.name: Best short ever

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well constructed and comfortable. Chamois holds up.
review.name: Nice shorts!

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
They stay up, look slim, wash well and have great cushioning. And the best of all: I dont feel them.

I love my Assos bib-less shorts.
review.name: Great Assos Product. You dont feel them.

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Priced as Porsche but you get a Chevy.......

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Half Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have two pair of the same shorts in bib form.  These feel just as good, possibly better in the legs.  Good compression, no discomfort around the waist, long rides in the saddle without undue pressure spots.  Great shorts.  Buying another two pair.
