review.itemreviewed: Maestrale RS Alpine Touring Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been using these for over a month at my downhill area.  They make a great hybrid boot with good downhill control and light and flexible enough for uphilling.  I like to hit the ski area late in the day, do a half dozen runs and ski up the mountain after they close.  Makes a nice way to spend an evening and at times you have the mountain mostly to yourself.
review.name: Great AT boot

review.reviewBody: As close to being barefoot as is possible- simply wonderful
review.name: Keen Quality

review.reviewBody:
This is my 3rd pair of sandals and never regretted purchasing them.
Provides comfort with light weight profile.
review.name: Durable & Comfortable sandals

review.reviewBody: Decent but not a targhee sandal. I think it will be better in the river while wet due to the narrower profile. We will see
review.name: I like the Targhee sandal better but this one looks serviceable

review.reviewBody: These are now my favorite pool shoe for water aerobics and water volleyball. They fit close to my foot, fit very well, and are easy to put on and take off. They are comfortable and dry quickly..
review.name: Outstanding Performance from water sandal.

review.reviewBody: These light but rugged sandals will take you anywhere, ideal if like me you are a bit skinny and often slop about a bit in sandals when walking distances, causing tired feet and making you wish you’d worn your trainers, not necessary with the Clearwater.
review.name: Slender Feet?

review.reviewBody: I have two arthritic big toes and bad arches sandals are usually a no go for me, but these are great!!
review.name: These are great

review.reviewBody: My 4th pair of the Clearwater CNX. Runs true to size. Highly recommend around land and water.
review.name: Excellent sandals!

review.reviewBody: Runs small.  Had to exchange for half size up.
review.name: Comfortable sandal

review.reviewBody: Excellent shoe for summer with good lateral support.
review.name: Excellent shoe for summer with

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite shoes I’ve ever owned!! They are so lightweight and comfortable. I bought the men’s version because I preferred the triple black colorway and the subtle design differences to the upper. They feel like wearing supportive dance shoes, super natural like a barefoot walking feeling. Nothing rubs or moves around. I love the super low profile of the upper and the outsole. They look really graceful not chunky or outdoorsy. I have bunions and these feel great! As far as sizing if any other women are thinking of purchasing these, I recommend measuring your foot in cm and following the Japanese sizing system. These are on the smaller end of my shoe size range but that’s relative to other brands which aren’t necessarily trustworthy anyway.
review.name: Best shoes ever buying second pair

name: Clearwater CNX Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. It's really light and comfortable and I like the fit and style. Will be excellent on the slopes in ideal conditions. It's not quite as warm and waterproof as I expected based on the ratings.
review.name: Really good jacket

review.reviewBody: Jacket is good but the zipper makes it unusable. Avoid this until after they fix the zipper issues.
The coat is warm with plenty of convenient pockets. The left forearm pocket is great for lift tickets. Vent systems also kept me from overheating on those late season slope days in northern AZ.
review.name: Fantastic into late season

review.reviewBody: This is my resort jacket and it keeps me warm and dry during wet ski days in the PNW. It has plenty of large pockets and allows me to store a sandwich when I want to skip lines at the lodge.
review.name: Warm and Performs Well

review.reviewBody: Awesome coat! Incredibly lightweight but warm. Great during an early spring surprise snowstorm in Upstate NY.
review.name: Surprisingly Light but Warm

review.reviewBody: Happy with the Snowcrew jacket. Tons of features built in, light and warm for weight. I tend to be in between sizes a lot (5'11, 175lbs) and this jacket is no exception. Large a bit big and medium probably a bit tight. My biggest issue is the main zipper. Very tricky to get it lined up and working properly. Hope that this can be fixed in the future.
review.name: Light, warm and feature packed

review.reviewBody: I had a GREAT experience with a warranty issue on a product and OR got me back on the hill. THANK YOU!
review.name: Great products and Great customer service

review.reviewBody: Third OR Jacket for me. This one replaced a circa 1980's red and blue deep cold jacket I was using that my kids were embarrassed to see me in. The Snow Crew is a Great Jacket. Been using it all seasons now. Same level of warmth as my old jacket, but lighter, easier to move in, better pockets / storage and all around solid. Waterproof and warm. I have two other lighter weight OR jackets that also do the job to a point, but this was has handled all the deep cold very well.
review.name: Third OR Jacket.. Love them all.

review.reviewBody: Got this jacket at the start of the season, it's been very wet in the PNW, and it's so far been warm, waterproof, visible, and roomy enough to add extra layers for those extra cold days. I got a size M and I'm 6'2 220lbs, and it still runs a bit puffy, but there is a hem drawcord to bring the bottom of the jacket in. My only complaint is that the thumb holes in the cuff need to be a bit further out. My arms aren't exceptionally long, and any reaching down really strains the thumb hole. Definitely not a deal breaker, just means you've gotta bend a little more to futz with the boots or bindings. Oh and I've had exactly 0 issues with the zipper.
review.name: Great all weather jacket

review.reviewBody: Repeat Customer and again i was extremely satisfied with the entire process. The website was user-friendly, the ordering process was seamless, and the product arrived on time and in perfect condition. Thank you Again OR for another fantastic experience!"
review.name: Repeat Customer
